hdr57806-health.Source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr57206-health.Definition: Probability of dying between birth and exactly age 1, expressed per 1,000 live births.
hdr57206-health.Source: UN Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (2019). Child mortality estimates. www.childmortality.org. Accessed 26 August 2020.

hdr57906-health.Definition: Probability that a 15-year-old will die before reaching age 60, expressed per 1,000 people.
hdr57906-health.Source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr57506-health.Definition: Probability of dying between birth and exactly age 5, expressed per 1,000 live births.
hdr57506-health.Source: UN Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (2019). Child mortality estimates. www.childmortality.org. Accessed 26 August 2020.

hdr182206-health.Definition: The estimated number of new and relapse tuberculosis cases of all forms, including cases in people living with HIV, expressed per 100,000 people.
hdr182206-health.Source: United Nations Statistics Division (2020a). Global SDG Indicators Database. https://unstats.un.org/sdgs/indicators/database/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr181106-humanSecurity.Definition: Proportion of children under 5 years of age whose births have been registered with a civil authority.
hdr181106-humanSecurity.Source: United Nations Statistics Division (2020a). Global SDG Indicators Database. https://unstats.un.org/sdgs/indicators/database/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr149406-humanSecurity.Indicator: Homeless people due to natural disaster
hdr149406-humanSecurity.Definition: Average annual number of people who lack a shelter for living quarters as a result of natural disasters, who carry their few possessions with them and who sleep in the streets, in doorways or on piers, or in any other space, on a more or less random basis, expressed per million people.

hdr61006-humanSecurity.Definition: Number of unlawful deaths inflicted upon a person with the intent to cause death or serious injury, expressed per 100,000 people.
hdr61006-humanSecurity.Source: UNODC (United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime) (2020). DATAUNODC. https://dataunodc.un.org. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr128306-humanSecurity.Definition: Number of persons held in prisons, penal institutions or correctional institutions on a specified day and should exclude non-criminal prisoners held for administrative purposes, for example, persons held pending investigation into their immigration status or foreign citizens without a legal right to stay, expressed per 100,000 people.
hdr128306-humanSecurity.Source: UNODC (United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime) (2020). DATAUNODC. https://dataunodc.un.org. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr21806-humanSecurity.Definition: Number of people who have fled their country of origin because of a well founded fear of persecution due to their race, religion, nationality, political opinion or membership in a particular social group and who cannot or do not want to return to their country of origin.
hdr21806-humanSecurity.Source: UNHCR (Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees) (2020). UNHCR Global Trends 2019. Geneva. www.unhcr.org/globaltrends2019/. Accessed 4 August 2020.

hdr112606-humanSecurity.Definition: Number of deaths from purposely self-inflicted injuries, expressed per 100,000 people in the reference population. The rates are age-standardized.
hdr112606-humanSecurity.Source: WHO (World Health Organization) (2020). Global Health Observatory. www.who.int/gho/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr112506-humanSecurity.Definition: Number of deaths from purposely self-inflicted injuries, expressed per 100,000 people in the reference population. The rates are age-standardized.
hdr112506-humanSecurity.Source: WHO (World Health Organization) (2020). Global Health Observatory. www.who.int/gho/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr123506-incomeCompositionOfResources.Indicator: Estimated gross national income per capita
hdr123506-incomeCompositionOfResources.Definition: Derived from the ratio of female to male wages, female and male shares of economically active population and gross national income (in 2017 purchasing power parity terms). See Technical note 3 at http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/hdr2020_technical_notes.pdf for details.
hdr123506-incomeCompositionOfResources.Source: HDRO calculations based on ILO (2020), UNDESA (2019a), World Bank (2020a), United Nations Statistics Division (2020b) and IMF (2020).

hdr123606-incomeCompositionOfResources.Indicator: Estimated gross national income per capita
hdr123606-incomeCompositionOfResources.Definition: Derived from the ratio of female to male wages, female and male shares of economically active population and gross national income (in 2017 purchasing power parity terms). See Technical note 3 at http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/hdr2020_technical_notes.pdf for details.
hdr123606-incomeCompositionOfResources.Source: HDRO calculations based on ILO (2020), UNDESA (2019a), World Bank (2020a), United Nations Statistics Division (2020b) and IMF (2020).

hdr194906-incomeCompositionOfResources.Definition: GDP in a particular period divided by the total population in the same period.
hdr194906-incomeCompositionOfResources.Source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr194506-incomeCompositionOfResources.Definition: Sum of gross value added by all resident producers in the economy plus any product taxes and minus any subsidies not included in the value of the products, expressed in 2017 international dollars using purchasing power parity (PPP) rates.
hdr194506-incomeCompositionOfResources.Source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr65606-incomeCompositionOfResources.Definition: Value of acquisitions of new or existing fixed assets by the business sector, governments and households (excluding their unincorporated enterprises) less disposals of fixed assets, expressed as a percentage of GDP. No adjustment is made for depreciation of fixed assets.
hdr65606-incomeCompositionOfResources.Source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr195706-incomeCompositionOfResources.Definition: Aggregate income of an economy generated by its production and its ownership of factors of production, less the incomes paid for the use of factors of production owned by the rest of the world, converted to international dollars using PPP rates, divided by midyear population.
hdr195706-incomeCompositionOfResources.Source: World Bank (2020a), IMF (2020) and United Nations Statistics Division (2020b)

hdr103606-incomeCompositionOfResources.Definition: GNI per capita (2017 PPP International $, using natural logarithm) expressed as an index using a minimum value of $100 and a maximum value $75,000.
hdr103606-incomeCompositionOfResources.Source: HDRO calculations based on GNI per capita (2017 PPP International $) from World Bank (2020a), World Development Indicators database. Accessed on 22 July 2020.

hdr183906-incomeCompositionOfResources.Indicator: Labour share of GDP, comprising wages and social protection transfers
hdr183906-incomeCompositionOfResources.Definition: Total compensation of employees, expressed as a percentage of GDP, which measures total output. Total compensation is the total remuneration, in cash or in kind, payable by an enterprise to an employee in return for work done by the employee during the accounting period.
hdr183906-incomeCompositionOfResources.Source: ILO (2020). ILOSTAT database. https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr135006-inequality.Definition: Average inequality in three basic dimensions of human development.
hdr135006-inequality.Source: Calculated as the arithmetic mean of the values in inequality in life expectancy, inequality in education and inequality in income using the methodology in Technical note 2 (available at http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/hdr2020_technical_notes.pdf).

hdr67106-inequality.Definition: Measure of the deviation of the distribution of income among individuals or households within a country from a perfectly equal distribution. A value of 0 represents absolute equality, a value of 100 absolute inequality.
hdr67106-inequality.Source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr135106-inequality.Definition: Ratio of the average income of the richest 20 percent of the population to the average income of the poorest 20 percent of the population.
hdr135106-inequality.Source: HDRO calculations based on data from World Bank (2019a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed on 15 July 2019.

hdr186906-inequality.Definition: Share of national income held by the poorest 40 percent of the population.
hdr186906-inequality.Source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr186106-inequality.Definition: Share of pre-tax national income held by the richest 1 percent of the population. Pre-tax national income is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labour and capital, before taking into account the  tax/transfer system and after taking into account the pension system.
hdr186106-inequality.Source: World Inequality Database (2020). World Inequality Database. http://wid.world. Accessed 20 August 2020.

hdr187006-inequality.Definition: Share of national income held by the richest 10 percent of the population.
hdr187006-inequality.Source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr101606-inequality.Definition: Inequality in distribution of years of schooling based on data from household surveys estimated using the Atkinson inequality index.
hdr101606-inequality.Source: Calculated based on data from the Luxembourg Income Study database, Eurostatâ€™s European Union Statistics on Income and Living Conditions, the World Bankâ€™s International Income Distribution Database, the Center for Distributive, Labor and Social Studies and the World Bankâ€™s Socio-Economic Database for Latin America and the Caribbean, ICF Macro Demographic and Health Surveys and United Nations Childrenâ€™s Fund Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys using the methodology in Technical note 2.

hdr101706-inequality.Definition: Inequality in income distribution based on data from household surveys estimated using the Atkinson inequality index.
hdr101706-inequality.Source: Calculated based on data from the Luxembourg Income Study database, Eurostatâ€™s European Union Statistics on Income and Living Conditions, the World Bankâ€™s International Income Distribution Database, the Center for Distributive, Labor and Social Studies and the World Bankâ€™s Socio-Economic Database for Latin America and the Caribbean, ICF Macro Demographic and Health Surveys and United Nations Childrenâ€™s Fund Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys using the methodology in Technical note 2.

hdr101806-inequality.Definition: Inequality in distribution of expected length of life based on data from life tables estimated using the Atkinson inequality index.
hdr101806-inequality.Source: Calculated based on abridged life tables from UNDESA (2019a).

hdr71406-inequality.Definition: HDI education index value adjusted for inequality in distribution of years of schooling based on data from household surveys listed in Main data sources.
hdr71406-inequality.Source: Calculated based on inequality in education and the HDI education index.

hdr138806-inequality.Definition: HDI value adjusted for inequalities in the three basic dimensions of human development. See Technical note 2 at http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/hdr2020_technical_notes.pdf for details on how the IHDI is calculated.
hdr138806-inequality.Source: Calculated as the geometric mean of the values in the inequality-adjusted life expectancy index, inequality-adjusted education index and inequality-adjusted income index using the methodology in Technical note 2 (available at http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/hdr2020_technical_notes.pdf).

hdr71606-inequality.Definition: HDI income index value adjusted for inequality in income distribution based on data from household surveys listed in Main data sources.
hdr71606-inequality.Source: Calculated based on inequality in income and the HDI income index.

hdr71506-inequality.Definition: HDI life expectancy index value adjusted for inequality in distribution of expected length of life based on data from life tables listed in Main data sources.
hdr71506-inequality.Source: Calculated based on inequality in life expectancy and the HDI life expectancy index.

hdr73506-inequality.Indicator: Overall loss in HDI due to inequality
hdr73506-inequality.Definition: Percentage difference between the IHDI value and the HDI value.
hdr73506-inequality.Source: Calculated based on data in columns 1 and 2.

hdr111106-mobilityAndCommunication.Definition: Arrivals of nonresident visitors (overnight visitors, tourists, sameday visitors and excursionists) at national borders.
hdr111106-mobilityAndCommunication.Source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr147206-mobilityAndCommunication.Definition: Total number of tertiary students from abroad (inbound students) studying in a given country minus the number of students at the same level of education from that country studying abroad (outbound students), expressed as a percentage of total tertiary enrolment in the country.
hdr147206-mobilityAndCommunication.Source: UNESCO (United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization) Institute for Statistics (2020). Data Centre. http://data.uis.unesco.org. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr178106-mobilityAndCommunication.Definition: Proportion of females who use the internet.
hdr178106-mobilityAndCommunication.Source: ITU (International Telecommunication Union) (2020). ICT Facts and Figures 2020. www.itu.int/en/ITU-D/Statistics/Pages/stat/. Accessed 2 September 2020.

hdr43606-mobilityAndCommunication.Definition: People with access to the worldwide network.
hdr43606-mobilityAndCommunication.Source: ITU (International Telecommunication Union) (2020). ICT Facts and Figures 2020. www.itu.int/en/ITU-D/Statistics/Pages/stat/. Accessed 2 September 2020.

hdr46006-mobilityAndCommunication.Definition: Number of subscriptions for the mobile phone service, expressed per 100 people.
hdr46006-mobilityAndCommunication.Source: ITU (International Telecommunication Union) (2020). ICT Facts and Figures 2020. www.itu.int/en/ITU-D/Statistics/Pages/stat/. Accessed 2 September 2020.

hdr110806-mobilityAndCommunication.Definition: Ratio of the difference between the number of in-migrants and out-migrants from a country to the average population, expressed per 1,000 people.

hdr117806-poverty.Indicator: Contribution of deprivation in education to the Multidimensional Poverty Index
hdr117806-poverty.Definition: Percentage of the Multidimensional Poverty Index attributed to deprivations in the education dimension.
hdr117806-poverty.Source: HDRO and OPHI calculations based on data on household deprivations in health, education, and standard of living from various surveys listed in column 1 using the methodology described in Technical note 5 (http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/mpi2021_technical_notes.pdf).

hdr117906-poverty.Indicator: Contribution of deprivation in health to the Multidimensional Poverty Index
hdr117906-poverty.Definition: Percentage of the Multidimensional Poverty Index attributed to deprivations in the health dimension.
hdr117906-poverty.Source: HDRO and OPHI calculations based on data on household deprivations in health, education, and standard of living from various surveys listed in column 1 using the methodology described in Technical note 5 (http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/mpi2021_technical_notes.pdf).

hdr118006-poverty.Indicator: Contribution of deprivation in standard of living to the Multidimensional Poverty Index
hdr118006-poverty.Definition: Percentage of the Multidimensional Poverty Index attributed to deprivations in the standard of living dimension.
hdr118006-poverty.Source: HDRO and OPHI calculations based on data on household deprivations in health, education, and standard of living from various surveys listed in column 1 using the methodology described in Technical note 5 (http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/mpi2021_technical_notes.pdf).

hdr38406-poverty.Definition: Percentage of the population that is multidimensionally poor adjusted by the intensity of the deprivations. See Technical note 5 at http:// hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/hdr2021_technical_ notes.pdf for details on how the Multidimensional Poverty Index is calculated.
hdr38406-poverty.Source: HDRO and OPHI calculations based on data on household deprivations in health, education, and standard of living from various surveys listed in column 1 using the methodology described in Technical note 5 (http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/mpi2021_technical_notes.pdf).

hdr38606-poverty.Definition: Percentage of the population with a deprivation score of at least 33 percent.
hdr38606-poverty.Source: HDRO and OPHI calculations based on data on household deprivations in health, education, and standard of living from various surveys listed in column 1 using the methodology described in Technical note 5 (http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/mpi2021_technical_notes.pdf).

hdr102006-poverty.Definition: Population with a deprivation score of at least 33 percent. It is expressed in thousands of the population of the year of the survey.
hdr102006-poverty.Dimension: for the year of the survey
hdr102006-poverty.Source: HDRO and OPHI calculations based on data on household deprivations in health, education, and standard of living from various surveys listed in column 1 using the methodology described in Technical note 5 (http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/mpi2021_technical_notes.pdf).

hdr183406-poverty.Definition: Population with a deprivation score of at least 33 percent. It is expressed in thousands of the 2019 population.
hdr183406-poverty.Source: HDRO and OPHI calculations based on data on household deprivations in health, education, and standard of living from various surveys listed in column 1 using the methodology described in Technical note 5 (http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/mpi2021_technical_notes.pdf).

hdr38506-poverty.Definition: Average deprivation score experienced by people in multidimensional poverty.
hdr38506-poverty.Source: HDRO and OPHI calculations based on data on household deprivations in health, education, and standard of living from various surveys listed in column 1 using the methodology described in Technical note 5 (http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/mpi2021_technical_notes.pdf).

hdr101006-poverty.Definition: Percentage of the population in severe multidimensional poverty—that is, those with a deprivation score of 50 percent or more.
hdr101006-poverty.Source: HDRO and OPHI calculations based on data on household deprivations in health, education, and standard of living from various surveys listed in column 1 using the methodology described in Technical note 5 (http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/mpi2021_technical_notes.pdf).

hdr39006-poverty.Indicator: Population living below income poverty line
hdr39006-poverty.Definition: Percentage of the population living below the national poverty line, which is the poverty line deemed appropriate for a country by its authorities. National estimates are based on population-weighted subgroup estimates from household surveys.
hdr39006-poverty.Source: World Bank. 2021. World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. Http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed July 8 2021.

hdr167106-poverty.Indicator: Population living below income poverty line
hdr167106-poverty.Definition: Percentage of the population living below the international poverty line of $1.90 (in purchasing power parity terms [PPP] ) a day.
hdr167106-poverty.Source: World Bank. 2021. World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. Http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed July 8 2021.

hdr142506-poverty.Definition: Percentage of the population at risk of suffering multiple deprivations—that is, those with a deprivation score of 20–33 percent.
hdr142506-poverty.Source: HDRO and OPHI calculations based on data on household deprivations in health, education, and standard of living from various surveys listed in column 1 using the methodology described in Technical note 5 (http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/mpi2021_technical_notes.pdf).

hdr153706-poverty.Indicator: Working poor at PPP$3.20 a day
hdr153706-poverty.Definition: Proportion of employed people who live on less than $3.20 (in purchasing power parity terms) a day, expressed as a percentage of the total employed population ages 15 and older.
hdr153706-poverty.Source: ILO (2020). ILOSTAT database. https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr164406-socioEconomicSustainability.Definition: Net national savings plus education expenditure and minus energy depletion, mineral depletion, net forest depletion, and carbon dioxide and particulate emissions damage. Net national savings are equal to gross national savings less the value of consumption of fixed capital.
hdr164406-socioEconomicSustainability.Source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr186806-socioEconomicSustainability.Indicator: Average annual change in the share of bottom 40 percent
hdr186806-socioEconomicSustainability.Definition: Annual compound change rate of the income share of the poorest 40 percent of the population over 2005â€“2018.
hdr186806-socioEconomicSustainability.Source: HDRO calculations based on data from World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed on 22 July 2020.

hdr170006-socioEconomicSustainability.Definition: A measure of the degree of product concentration in exports from a country (also referred to as the Herfindahl-Hirschmann Index). A value closer to 0 indicates that a countryâ€™s exports are more homogeneously distributed among a series of products (reflecting a well diversified economy); a value closer to 1 indicates that a countryâ€™s exports are highly concentrated among a few products.
hdr170006-socioEconomicSustainability.Source: UNCTAD (United Nations Conference on Trade and Development) (2020). Data Center. http://unctadstat.unctad.org. Accessed11 September 2020.

hdr178306-socioEconomicSustainability.Definition: Outlays on additions to the fixed assets of the economy plus net changes in inventories. Fixed assets include land improvements (such as fences, ditches and drains); plant, machinery and equipment purchases; and construction of roads, railways and the like, including schools, offices, hospitals, private residential dwellings and commercial and industrial buildings. Inventories are stocks of goods held by firms to meet temporary or unexpected fluctuations in production or sales as well as goods that are work in progress. Net acquisitions of valuables are also considered capital formation. Gross capital formation was formerly known as gross domestic investment.
hdr178306-socioEconomicSustainability.Source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr183206-socioEconomicSustainability.Indicator: Overall loss in HDI value due to inequality
hdr183206-socioEconomicSustainability.Definition: Annual compound change rate of the overall loss in Human Development Index (HDI) value due to inequality over 2010â€“2019.
hdr183206-socioEconomicSustainability.Source: HDRO calculations based on the Inequality-adjusted HDI time series.

hdr182806-socioEconomicSustainability.Indicator: Population using safely managed drinking-water services
hdr182806-socioEconomicSustainability.Definition: Percentage of the population drinking water from an improved source that is accessible on premises, available when needed and free from faecal and priority chemical contamination. Improved water sources include piped water, boreholes or tubewells, protected dug wells, protected springs, and packaged or delivered water
hdr182806-socioEconomicSustainability.Source: WHO (World Health Organization) (2020). Global Health Observatory. www.who.int/gho/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr195206-socioEconomicSustainability.Indicator: Population using safely managed sanitation services
hdr195206-socioEconomicSustainability.Definition: Percentage of the population using an improved sanitation facility that is not shared with other households and where excreta are safely disposed of in situ or treated off site. Improved sanitation facilities include flush/pour flush toilets connected to piped sewer systems, septic tanks or pit latrines; pit latrines with slabs (including ventilated pit latrines, and composting toilets.
hdr195206-socioEconomicSustainability.Source: WHO (World Health Organization) (2020). Global Health Observatory. www.who.int/gho/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr179706-socioEconomicSustainability.Indicator: Ratio of education and health expenditure to military expenditure
hdr179706-socioEconomicSustainability.Definition: Sum of government expenditure on education and health divided by military expenditure.
hdr179706-socioEconomicSustainability.Source: HDRO calculations based on data from World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed on 22 July 2020.

hdr52306-socioEconomicSustainability.Definition: Current and capital expenditures (both public and private) on creative work undertaken systematically to increase knowledge, including knowledge of humanity, culture and society, and the use of knowledge for new applications. Research and development covers basic research, applied research and experimental development.
hdr52306-socioEconomicSustainability.Source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr181706-socioEconomicSustainability.Indicator: Rural population with access to electricity
hdr181706-socioEconomicSustainability.Definition: People living in rural areas with access to electricity, expressed as a percentage of the total rural population. It includes electricity sold commercially (both on grid and off grid) and self-generated electricity but excludes unauthorized connections.
hdr181706-socioEconomicSustainability.Source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr179406-socioEconomicSustainability.Definition: Percentage of the labour force ages 15 and older with intermediate or advanced education, as classified by the International Standard Classification of Education.
hdr179406-socioEconomicSustainability.Source: ILO (2020). ILOSTAT database. https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr174206-socioEconomicSustainability.Definition: Sum of principal repayments and interest actually paid in currency, goods or services on long-term debt; interest paid on short-term debt; and repayments (repurchases and charges) to the International Monetary Fund. It is expressed as a percentage of exports of goods, services and primary income.
hdr174206-socioEconomicSustainability.Units: % of exports of goods, services and primary income
hdr174206-socioEconomicSustainability.Source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr133206-tradeAndFinancialFlows.Definition: Sum of exports and imports of goods and services, expressed as a percentage of gross domestic product (GDP). It is a basic indicator of openness to foreign trade and economic integration and indicates the dependence of domestic producers on foreign demand (exports) and of domestic consumers and producers on foreign supply (imports), relative to the countryâ€™s economic size (GDP).
hdr133206-tradeAndFinancialFlows.Source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr53506-tradeAndFinancialFlows.Definition: Sum of equity capital, reinvestment of earnings, other longterm capital and short-term capital, expressed as a percentage of GDP.
hdr53506-tradeAndFinancialFlows.Source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr99106-tradeAndFinancialFlows.Definition: Disbursements of loans made on concessional terms (net of repayments of principal) and grants by official agencies to promote economic development and welfare in countries and territories on the Development Assistance Committee list of aid recipients, expressed as a percentage of the recipient countryâ€™s gross national income (GNI).
hdr99106-tradeAndFinancialFlows.Source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr111306-tradeAndFinancialFlows.Definition: Net foreign direct investment and portfolio investment, expressed as a percentage of GDP.
hdr111306-tradeAndFinancialFlows.Source: HDRO calculations based on data from World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed on 22 July 2020.

hdr52606-tradeAndFinancialFlows.Definition: Earnings and material resources transferred by international migrants or refugees to recipients in their country of origin or countries in which the migrant formerly resided.
hdr52606-tradeAndFinancialFlows.Source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr181306-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Definition: Percentage of children ages 5â€“11 who, during the reference week, engaged in at least one hour of economic activity and/or involved in unpaid household services for more than 21 hours; children ages 12â€“14 who, during the reference week, engaged in at least 14 hours of economic activity and/or involved in unpaid household services for more than 21 hours; children ages 15â€“17 who, during the reference week, engaged in at least 43 hours of economic activity; or children ages 5â€“17 who, during the reference week, engaged in hazardous working conditions or any worst forms of child labour other than hazardous.
hdr181306-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Source: United Nations Statistics Division (2020a). Global SDG Indicators Database. https://unstats.un.org/sdgs/indicators/database/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr150606-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Definition: Share of total employment that is employed in agriculture.
hdr150606-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Source: ILO (2020). ILOSTAT database. https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr150706-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Definition: Share of total employment that is employed in services.
hdr150706-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Source: ILO (2020). ILOSTAT database. https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr148306-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Definition: Percentage of the population ages 15 years and older that is employed.
hdr148306-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Source: ILO (2020). ILOSTAT database. https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr48806-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Definition: Proportion of the working-age population (ages 15 and older) that engages in the labour market, either by working or actively looking for work, expressed as a percentage of the working-age population.
hdr48806-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Source: ILO (2020). ILOSTAT database. https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr148206-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Definition: Percentage of a countryâ€™s working-age population that engages actively in the labour market, either by working or looking for work. It provides an indication of the relative size of the supply of labour available to engage in the production of goods and services.
hdr148206-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Source: ILO (2020). ILOSTAT database. https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr123806-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Definition: Proportion of people older than the statutory pensionable age receiving an old-age pension (contributory, noncontributory or both), expressed as a percentage of the eligible population.
hdr123806-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Source: United Nations Statistics Division (2020a). Global SDG Indicators Database. https://unstats.un.org/sdgs/indicators/database/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr184006-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Indicator: Proportion of informal employment in nonagricultural employment
hdr184006-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Definition: Share of informal employment in total employment in the nonagricultural sector.
hdr184006-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Source: ILO (2020). ILOSTAT database. https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr193006-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Indicator: Proportion of informal employment in nonagricultural employment
hdr193006-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Definition: Share of women in informal employment in total employment in the nonagricultural sector.
hdr193006-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Source: ILO (2020). ILOSTAT database. https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr140606-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Definition: Percentage of the labour force population ages 15 and older that is not in paid employment or self-employed but is available for work and has taken steps to seek paid employment or self-employment.
hdr140606-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Source: ILO (2020). ILOSTAT database. https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr110906-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Definition: Percentage of the labour force population ages 15â€“24 that is not in paid employment or self-employed but is available for work and has taken steps to seek paid employment or self-employment.
hdr110906-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Source: ILO (2020). ILOSTAT database. https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr43006-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Definition: Percentage of employed people engaged as contributing family workers and own-account workers.
hdr43006-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Source: ILO (2020). ILOSTAT database. https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr147906-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Indicator: Youth not in school or employment
hdr147906-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Definition: Percentage of people ages 15â€“24 who are not in employment or in education or training.
hdr147906-workEmploymentAndVulnerability.Source: ILO (2020). ILOSTAT database. https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr177006-education.Indicator: Programme for International Student Assessment (PISA) score
hdr177006-education.Definition: Score obtained in testing of skills and knowledge of 15-year-old students in mathematics.
hdr177006-education.Source: OECD (Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development) (2019a). PISA 2018 Results in Focus. Paris www.oecd.org/pisa/. Accessed 8 September 2020.

hdr176906-education.Indicator: Programme for International Student Assessment (PISA) score
hdr176906-education.Definition: Score obtained in testing of skills and knowledge of 15-year-old students in in reading.
hdr176906-education.Source: OECD (Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development) (2019a). PISA 2018 Results in Focus. Paris www.oecd.org/pisa/. Accessed 8 September 2020.

hdr176806-education.Indicator: Programme for International Student Assessment (PISA) score
hdr176806-education.Definition: Score obtained in testing of skills and knowledge of 15-year-old students in science.
hdr176806-education.Source: OECD (Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development) (2019a). PISA 2018 Results in Focus. Paris www.oecd.org/pisa/. Accessed 8 September 2020.

twap_ind_sids_mannualgwrechargedepth-ind.Definition: Long-term average groundwater recharge (including man-made components like return-flows, induced recharge and artificial recharge) [m3/yr], divided by the surface area of the island [m2]. Unit: [mm/yr] or [litre/m2/yr].

twap_ind_sids_mannualrenewablegwpercap-i.Indicator: S1.2 Renewable groundwater resources per capita
twap_ind_sids_mannualrenewablegwpercap-i.Definition: Groundwater recharge (including man-made components like return-flows, induced recharge and artificial recharge) [m3/yr], divided by the number of inhabitants on top of the aquifer [capita].

twap_ind_sids_natbackgwquality-indicator.Definition: Percentage of surface area of the aquifer where the natural groundwater quality satisfies local drinking water standards (i.e. percentage of aquifer area which is not affected by natural salinity, arsenic, fluoride, etc.).

twap_ind_sids_aqbuffcapacity-indicator.Definition: Volume of groundwater stored in the aquifer [m3] divided by groundwater recharge [m3/yr].

twap_ind_sids_aqvulnerabilityclimchange-.Definition: Expected groundwater budget regime change in response to changes in climatic conditions. Indicator takes into account the degree of confinement, aquifer lithology, recharge and depth to groundwater table (see TWAP Groundwater methodology report for details).

twap_ind_sids_aqvulnerabilitypollution-i.Definition: Percentage of surface area where the aquifer is considered moderately to highly vulnerable to pollution. Indicator takes into account the degree of confinement, aquifer lithology and depth to groundwater table (see TWAP Groundwater methodology report for details).

twap_ind_sids_humandepgw-indicator.Definition: Volume of groundwater used [m3/yr] expressed as a percentage of total volume of water used [m3/yr].

twap_ind_sids_humandepgwdomestic-indicat.Indicator: S2.2 Human dependency on groundwater for domestic use
twap_ind_sids_humandepgwdomestic-indicat.Definition: Volume of groundwater for domestic use [m3/yr] expressed as a percentage of total domestic water use [m3/yr].

twap_ind_sids_humandepgwagricult-indicat.Indicator: S2.3 Human dependency on groundwater for agricultural use [%]
twap_ind_sids_humandepgwagricult-indicat.Definition: Volume of groundwater for agricultural use [m3/yr] expressed as a percentage of total agricultural water use [m3/yr].

twap_ind_sids_humandepgwindustry-indicat.Indicator: S2.4 Human dependency on groundwater for industrial use
twap_ind_sids_humandepgwindustry-indicat.Definition: Volume of groundwater for industrial use [m3/yr] expressed as a percentage of total industrial water use m3/yr].

twap_ind_sids_ecosystdepgw-indicator.Definition: Percentage of surface area of the aquifer where the phreatic water level is less than 5 m below the surface, or percentage of surface area of the aquifer covered by groundwater dependent ecosystems.

twap_ind_sids_prevelancesprings-indicato.Definition: Average annual groundwater discharge by springs [m3/yr] divided by Groundwater recharge [m3/yr]. (Springs are very sensitive to changes in groundwater budget, either from change in recharge or change in abstraction regime. Therefore spring discharge is a meaningful indicator of change.).

twap_ind_sids_gwdepletion2-indicator.Definition: Observed rate of long-term progressive decrease of groundwater storage (accompanied by steadily declining groundwater levels), expressed as an equivalent depth of water averaged over the island area. Preferred period: 2000-2010.

twap_ind_sids_gwpollution-indicator.Definition: Observed areal extent of polluted zones as a percentage of total aquifer area.

twap_ind_sids_saltwaterintrusion-indicat.Definition: Observed zones of saltwater intrusion as a percentage of total island area (due to salinity exceeding drinking water quality standards).

twap_ind_sids_popdensity-indicator.Definition: Number of inhabitants of the island [capita] divided by surface area of the island [km2].

twap_ind_sids_gwdevelopmentstress-indica.Definition: Total annual groundwater abstraction [m3/yr] divided by groundwater recharge [m3/yr].

twap_ind_sids_transblegalframework-indic.Definition: Existence, status and comprehensiveness of groundwater legislation.

twap_ind_sids_transbinstframework-indica.Definition: Existence, mandate and capabilities of institutions or institutional arrangements for managing SIDS groundwater.

twap_ind_sids_controlgwabstraction-indic.Definition: Current practices on the implementation of measures to control groundwater abstraction.

twap_ind_sids_gwqualityprotection-indica.Definition: Current practices on the implementation of groundwater quality protection.

twap_sids_socioeconomic_anabstractionblu.Indicator: Blue water abstraction for agricultural water supply
Blue water abstraction for domestic water supply (SD.)
Blue water abstraction for industrial water supply

twap_sids_hydrogeological_depthtosaltwat.Indicator: Depth to saltwater near the coast (SD.)

twap_sids_environmental_exptchangeaet50y.Indicator: Expected change in AET rate next 50 years (SD.)

twap_sids_environmental_exptchangeprecip.Indicator: Expected change in precipitation rate next 50 years (SD.)

twap_sids_socioeconomic_gwasbtractionagr.Indicator: Groundwater abstraction for agricultural and livestock water supply

twap_sids_socioeconomic_gwabstractiondom.Indicator: Groundwater abstraction for domestic water supply  (SD.)

twap_sids_socioeconomic_gwabstractind-ch.Indicator: Groundwater abstraction for industrial water supply (SD.)

twap_sids_environmental_increasesaltwati.Indicator: Increase of the saltwater intrusion over the period (SD.)

twap_sids_legal_institutionalaspects-cha.Indicator: Institutional framework related to groundwater management (SD.)

twap_sids_legal_legalaspects-characteris.Indicator: Legal framework related to groundwater management (SD.)

twap_sids_legal_qnt_gwabsobligmonit-char.Indicator: Obligatory monitoring of the abstraction by groundwater users (SD.)

twap_sids_legal_qlt_obligstudies-charact.Indicator: Obligatory studies on groundwater quality protection (Q.SD)

twap_sids_legal_qnt_gwabsobligstudies-ch.Indicator: Obligatory studies on the effect of groundwater abstraction (SD.)

twap_sids_socioeconomic_percpopulationsa.Indicator: Percentage of population covered by public sanitation services (SD.)

twap_sids_legal_qnt_protcareas-character.Indicator: Protected areas designated (with limited/no groundwater abstraction) (SD.)

twap_sids_legal_qnt_publawar-characteris.Indicator: Public awareness raising on effects of groundwater abstraction (SD.)

twap_sids_legal_qlt_publawar-characteris.Indicator: Public awareness raising on groundwater protection (SD.)

twap_sids_legal_qlt_landfields-character.Indicator: Regulations on the design and management of landfills (SD.)

twap_sids_legal_qlt_wstdisp-characterist.Indicator: Regulations on the disposal of waste (SD.)

twap_sids_legal_qlt_hzubst-characteristi.Indicator: Regulations on the use/control/disposal of hazardous substances (SD.)

twap_sids_legal_qnt_resttaxenerg-charact.Indicator: Restrictions on taxes on energy used for groundwater abstraction (SD.)

twap_sids_legal_qlt_lndusereg-characteri.Indicator: SIDS: Land use regulations related to groundwater quality protection (SD.)

twap_sids_legal_qnt_subsenerg-characteri.Indicator: Subsidies on energy used for groundwater abstraction (SD.)

anorexia-nervosa-eatingDisorders.Definition:
AN is an eating disorder incorporating deaths and disability from refusal to maintain minimally normal body weight, intense fear of gaining weight, and disturbances in how one’s body weight or shape is experienced. DSM and ICD diagnostic criteria were used.
Anorexia nervosa (AN) resulted in 0·85 million (95% UI 0·51–1·32) global DALYs in 2019. AN contributed to 0·7% (0·5–1·0) of DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

bulimia-nervosa-eatingDisorders.Definition:
BN is an eating disorder, incorporating deaths and disability from recurrent binge eating, inappropriate compensatory behaviour to prevent weight gain, and undue influence of body shape and weight on self-evaluation. DSM and ICD diagnostic criteria were used.
Bulimia nervosa (BN) resulted in 2·07 million (95% UI 1·19–3·20) global DALYs in 2019. BN contributed to 1·6% (1·1–2·3) of DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

autism-spectrum-disorders-mentalDisorder.Definition:
ASD are a group of neurodevelopmental disorders with onset occurring in early childhood. They incorporate disability from pervasive impairment in several areas of development, including social interaction and communication skills, along with restricted and repetitive patterns of behaviours or interests.
Autism spectrum disorders (ASD) resulted in 4·31 million (95% UI 2·82–6·23) global DALYs in 2019, equivalent to 0·2% (0·1–0·2) of DALYs. ASD contributed to 3·4% (2·7–4·3) of DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

attention-deficit/hyperactivity-disorder.Definition:
ADHD is an externalising disorder, incorporating disability from persistent inattention and/or hyperactivity/impulsivity. DSM-IV-TR (314.0, 314.01) and ICD-10 (F90) criteria were used.
Attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) resulted in 1·03 million (95% UI 0·58–1·74) global DALYs in 2019. ADHD contributed to 0·8% (0·5–1·4) of DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

conduct-disorder-mentalDisorders.Definition:
CD occurs in those under 18 years of age and incorporates disability from antisocial behaviour that violates basic rights of others or major age-appropriate societal norms. DSM-IV-TR (312.81–312.89) and ICD-10 (F91) diagnostic criteria were used.
Conduct disorder (CD) resulted in 4·87 million (95% UI 2·74–7·62) global DALYs in 2019, equivalent to 0·2% (0·1–0·3) of DALYs. CD contributed to 3·9% (2·6–5·5) of DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

idiopathic-developmental-intellectual-di.Definition:
This cause captures the health loss resulting from intellectual disability that arises from any unknown source.
Idiopathic developmental intellectual disability (ID) was responsible for 4·39 million (95% UI 2·30–7·24) YLDs in 2019. In South Asia, the age-standardised rate of YLDs for ID was 142·9 per 100 000 (80·7–228·5), nearly twice that of any other world region.

other-mental-disorders-mentalDisorders.Definition:
This residual cause incorporates disability from personality disorders, which are characterised by pervasive, inflexible, and maladaptive behaviour that is markedly different from what is considered culturally acceptable. DSM and ICD criteria were used.
Other mental disorders resulted in 8·65 million (95% UI 5·58–13·1) global DALYs in 2019, equivalent to 0·3% (0·2–0·5) of DALYs. They contributed to 6·9% (5·0–9·4) of DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

drowning-unintentionalInjuries.Definition:
Drowning includes deaths and disability associated with unintentional immersion in water or another fluid. Cases due to water transport or natural disasters are assigned elsewhere. Included are ICD-10: W65–W70.9, W73–W74.9; ICD-9: E910–E910.99.
Drowning was responsible for 237 000 deaths (95% UI 215 000–262 000) in 2019. 88 100 deaths (76 500–102 000) occurred in those under age 20, constituting 37·1% (34·2–40·2) of all drowning deaths. Drowning was the 12th-leading Level 3 cause of death in 2019 in those under age 20.

fire,-heat,-and-hot-substances-unintenti.Definition:
Death or disability due to unintentional exposure to substances of high temperature, including hot liquid, solid, or gas such as cooking stoves, smoke, steam, drinks, machinery, appliances, tools, radiators, and objects radiating heat energy.
Fire, heat, and hot substances was responsible for 111 000 deaths (95% UI 88 200–132 000) in 2019, with an age-standardised mortality rate (ASMR) that decreased by 17·2% (5·3–25·2) from 2010 to 2019.

poisonings-unintentionalInjuries.Definition:
Unintentional exposure to a non-infectious substance which contacts or enters the body via inhalation, ingestion, injection, or absorption, and causes deranged physiological function or death.
Poisonings caused 77 200 deaths (95% UI 63 800–85 400) in 2019. The age-standardised mortality rate (ASMR) of poisonings deceased from 1·3 per 100 000 (1·1–1·4) in 2010 to 1·0 per 100 000 (0·8–1·1) in 2019; it was highest in 2019 in eastern sub-Saharan Africa.

poisoning-by-carbon-monoxide-poisonings.Definition:
Death from exposure to or non-fatal exposure to carbon monoxide (CO) as identified based on carboxyhaemoglobin levels (specified based on smoking status and age) or proximity to a confirmed CO poisoning case. ICD-9: E862–E862.99, E868–E869.99, ICD-10: J70.5, X47–X47.9.
Poisoning by carbon monoxide caused 41 100 deaths (95% UI 33 000–45 900) in 2019. 19·1% (16·0–24·1) of deaths occurred in eastern Europe, which had an age-standardised mortality rate that was 207·1% (152·1–264·8) higher than the next highest region.

poisoning-by-other-means-poisonings.Definition:
Unintentional exposure to a non-infectious substance (other than carbon monoxide) which contacts the body or enters into the body via inhalation, ingestion, injection, or absorption and causes deranged physiological function of body or death.
Poisoning by other means caused 36 000 deaths (95% UI 27 700–44 000) in 2019. Age-standardised mortality rate (ASMR) from poisoning by other means decreased from 0·6 per 100 000 (0·5–0·7) in 2010 to 0·5 per 100 000 (0·4–0·6) in 2019.

exposure-to-mechanical-forces-unintentio.Definition:
Unintentional death or disability resulting from contact with or threat of an animate or inanimate object, human, or plant. This category includes unintentional firearm injuries as well as other miscellaneous forces (eg, power tools or household machinery).
Exposure to mechanical forces was responsible for 122 000 deaths (95% UI 95 400–141 000) in 2019. Age-standardised mortality rates decreased from 1·9 per 100 000 (1·5–2·1) in 2010 to 1·6 per 100 000 (1·2–1·8) in 2019.

unintentional-firearm-injuries-exposureT.Definition:
Unintentional death or disability resulting from a firearm. This does not include injuries where harm was intended by the person causing the injury. ICD9: E922–E922.99, E928.7. ICD10: W32–W34.9.
Unintentional firearm injuries was responsible for 20 100 deaths (95% UI 14 700–25 100) in 2019.

other-exposure-to-mechanical-forces-expo.Definition:
Unintentional death or disability resulting from contact with or threat of an animate or inanimate non-firearm object, human, or plant. This category includes miscellaneous forces such as contact with power tools and household machinery or human stampeding.
Other exposure to mechanical forces was responsible for 102 000 deaths (95% UI 78 100–117 000) in 2019. Age-standardised mortality rates (ASMRs) were highest in the low SDI quintile (1·8 per 100 000 [1·4–2·3]) and declined globally between 2010 and 2019.

adverse-effects-of-medical-treatment-uni.Definition:
Death or short-term or long-term disability sustained as the result of undergoing a procedure, treatment, or other exposure to the health-care system. This exposure can occur in inpatient admission, outpatient facilities, emergency care, or during home treatment.
Adverse effects of medical treatment were responsible for 106 000 deaths (95% UI 89 100–117 000) in 2019. The age-standardised mortality rate decreased from 1·5 per 100 000 (1·3–1·7) in 2010 to 1·4 per 100 000 (1·1–1·5) in 2019.

animal-contact-unintentionalInjuries.Definition:
Animal contact includes deaths and injuries resulting from unintentionally being attacked, struck, impaled, bitten, stung, crushed, exposed to, or stepped on by a non-human animal. Included are ICD-9: E905–E906.99, ICD-10: W52.0–W62.9, W64–W64.9, X20–X29.9.
Animal contact (venomous and non-venomous) caused 93 500 deaths (95% UI 61 900–114 000) in 2019. 67·7% (58·2–72·2) of global deaths occurred in south Asia. Age-standardised death rates decreased by 15·9% (-25·6 to -1·8) between 2010 and 2019.

venomous-animal-contact-animalContact.Definition:
Death or disability resulting from unintentionally being bitten by, stung by, or exposed to a venomous animal. ICD9: E905–E905.99, ICD10: W52.3, X20–X29.9.
Envenomation caused 79 700 deaths (95% UI 51 200–98 500) in 2019. Age-standardised mortality rates globally decreased from 1·2 per 100 000 (0·8–1·4) in 2010 to 1·0 per 100 000 (0·6–1·3) in 2019. 61 700 envenomation deaths (36 100–77 700) occurred in south Asia.

non-venomous-animal-contact-animalContac.Definition:
Death or disability resulting from unintentionally being attacked, struck, impaled, crushed, exposed to, or stepped on by a non-venomous animal.
Non-venomous animal contact was responsible for 13 700 deaths (95% UI 11 300–17 100) in 2019. 6780 deaths (5150–9440) occurred in the low SDI quintile.

foreign-body-unintentionalInjuries.Definition:
Unintentional death or bodily damage from an extraneous material or substance being within the body, including the airway, lungs, nose, and eyes.
Foreign body injuries were responsible for 6·47 million (95% UI 5·76–7·25) DALYs in 2019. The age group with the highest DALY rate in 2019 was early neonatal, which had an age-specific DALY rate of 8290 per 100 000 (6840–10 000) in 2019.

pulmonary-aspiration-and-foreign-body-in.Indicator: Pulmonary aspiration and foreign body in airway
pulmonary-aspiration-and-foreign-body-in.Definition:
Unintentional death or disability from inhaling, swallowing, or aspirating extraneous materials or substance that enters the airway or lungs.
Pulmonary aspiration and foreign body in airway was responsible for 109 000 deaths (95% UI 100 000–117 000) in 2019. The age-standardised mortality rate (ASMR) decreased from 1·7 per 100 000 (1·6–1·8) in 2010 to 1·5 per 100 000 (1·4–1·6) in 2019.

foreign-body-in-eyes-foreignBody.Definition:
Unintentional tissue damage from extraneous materials or substance in the orbital structure or eye.
Foreign body in eyes injury was responsible for 46·6 million (95% UI 32·5–64·5) new incident cases in 2019. New cases were most common in the 30–34 year age group (incidence 8710 per 100 000 [3530–18 800]) and in males (age-standardised incidence 8170 per 100 000 [5650–11 300]) in 2019.

digestive-diseases-nonCommunicableDiseas.Definition:
This Level 2 cause encompasses estimates of death and disability from all digestive diseases specified in the GBD cause list (eg, peptic ulcer disease, appendicitis) and from multiple digestive diseases summarised in the category of “other digestive diseases."
All digestive diseases together resulted in 89·0 million (95% UI 81·4–97·6) global DALYs in 2019 and were responsible for 3·5% (3·3–3·8) of total global DALYs.

peptic-ulcer-disease-upperDigestiveSyste.Definition:
This cause comprises death and disability due to defects in the lining of the stomach or duodenum that extend through the muscularis mucosa into deeper layers, primarily due to infection with Helicobacter pylori or use of non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs.
Peptic ulcer disease resulted in 6·03 million (95% UI 5·59–6·64) global DALYs in 2019, down from 8·20 million (7·58–8·97) global DALYs in 1990.

gastritis-and-duodenitis-upperDigestiveS.Definition:
This cause comprises death and disability resulting from damage and regeneration to lining of stomach or duodenum, with or without inflammation, but without ulceration. This can result from diverse aetiologies, but is primarily due to infection with Helicobacter pylori or use of non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs.
Gastritis and duodenitis resulted in 2·81 million (95% UI 2·09–3·79) global DALYs in 2019.

appendicitis-digestiveDiseases.Definition:
This Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from an inflammation of the appendix.
17·7 million (95% UI 14·1–22·3) cases of appendicitis occurred in 2019, resulting in 33 400 deaths (27 300–38 100) and 1·50 million (1·24–1·71) global DALYs.

paralytic-ileus-and-intestinal-obstructi.Definition:
This Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from a lack of digestive propulsion caused by failed peristalsis.
10·1 million (95% UI 9·75–10·4) cases of paralytic ileus and intestinal obstruction occurred in 2019, resulting in 239 000 deaths (199 000–266 000) and 7·08 million (5·65–8·25) global DALYs.

inguinal,-femoral,-and-abdominal-hernia-.Definition:
This Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from hernias in which portions of the digestive tract protrude through defects in the walls of the abdominal cavity.
There were 32·5 million (95% UI 27·7–37·8) prevalent cases of inguinal, femoral, and abdominal hernia in 2019, resulting in 48 100 deaths (41 700–54 000) and 3·35 million (2·61–4·25) global DALYs.

inflammatory-bowel-disease-digestiveDise.Definition:
This Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability from ulcerative colitis, Crohn’s disease, and indeterminate cases of non-infectious inflammatory bowel disease—autoimmune diseases characterised by inflammation of the colon and gastrointestinal tract.
There were 4·90 million (95% UI 4·35–5·50) prevalent cases of inflammatory bowel disease in 2019, resulting in 41 000 deaths (34 900–44 700) and 1·62 million (1·36–1·92) global DALYs.

vascular-intestinal-disorders-digestiveD.Definition:
This Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from ischaemic disorders and vascular malformations of the digestive tract.
1·46 million (95% UI 1·26–1·65) cases of vascular intestinal disorders occurred in 2019, resulting in 107 000 deaths (95 100–116 000) and 1·87 million (1·72–2·03) global DALYs.

gallbladder-and-biliary-diseases-digesti.Definition:
This Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from gallbladder and biliary diseases, such as gallstones, cholecystitis, and cholangitis.
193 million (95% UI 167–229) prevalent cases of gallbladder and biliary diseases occurred in 2019, resulting in 125 000 deaths (107 000–139 000) and 6·35 million (4·87–8·25) global DALYs.

pancreatitis-digestiveDiseases.Definition:
This Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from inflammation of the pancreas; morbidity due to both acute episodes and chronic inflammatory changes is included.
2·81 million (95% UI 2·41–3·29) cases of pancreatitis occurred in 2019, resulting in 2·41 million (2·16–2·64) prevalent cases, 115 000 deaths (104 000–128 000), and 3·64 million (3·28–4·03) global DALYs.

gastroesophageal-reflux-disease-upperDig.Definition:
GERD results when reflux of stomach contents into the oesophagus causes bothersome symptoms or complications. Only non-fatal health loss directly attributable to reflux is reflected here.
Gastro-oesophageal reflux disease (GERD) resulted in 6·03 million (95% UI 3·10–10·8) global YLDs in 2019 and was responsible for 0·7% (0·4–1·1) of total global YLDs.

endocrine,-metabolic,-blood,-and-immune-.Indicator: Endocrine, metabolic, blood, and immune disorders
endocrine,-metabolic,-blood,-and-immune-.Definition:
This Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from a residual group of conditions consisting mainly of thyroid disorders, rare metabolic and immune disorders, and blood disorders not resulting in anaemia.
There were 521 million (95% UI 459–594) prevalent cases of endocrine, metabolic, blood, and immune disorders (EMBID) in 2019, resulting in 162 000 deaths (131 000–179 000) and 22·9 million (17·0–30·0) global DALYs.

musculoskeletal-disorders-nonCommunicabl.Definition:
This aggregate cause incorporates death and, mostly, disability resulting from rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, low back pain, neck pain, gout, and a large residual category of other musculoskeletal disorders.
Musculoskeletal disorders was responsible for 150 million (95% UI 109–198) DALYs, or 5·9% (4·6–7·3) of total DALYs in 2019, 98·1% (97·3–98·7) of which were YLDs.

rheumatoid-arthritis-musculoskeletalDiso.Definition:
RA is a systemic autoimmune disorder that causes pain, swelling, and deformation of the joints and may be accompanied by systemic symptoms. The reference case definition for RA is based on the 1987 criteria by the American College of Rheumatology.
Rheumatoid arthritis (RA) resulted in 3·26 million (95% UI 2·51–4·09) global DALYs in 2019 and was responsible for 0·1% (0·1–0·2) of total global DALYs. 74·2% (65·8–80·6) of RA DALYs were due to YLDs.

osteoarthritis-musculoskeletalDisorders.Definition:
OA is the most common form of arthritis, involving chronic inflammation, breakdown, and structural alterations of whole joints.
Osteoarthritis (OA) resulted in 18·9 million (95% UI 9·57–37·7) global YLDs in 2019 and was responsible for 2·2% (1·3–4·1) of total global YLDs. OA knee, hip, hand, and other site contributed 60·9%, 5·5%, 23·5%, and 10·2% of OA YLDs, respectively.

low-back-pain-musculoskeletalDisorders.Definition:
Low back pain is defined as pain in the area on the posterior aspect of the body from the lower margin of the twelfth ribs to the lower gluteal folds (with or without pain referred into one or both lower limbs) that lasts for at least one day.
Low back pain was the leading Level 3 cause of YLDs, responsible for 63·7 million (95% UI 45·0–85·2) YLDs, or 7·4% (6·2–8·7) of total global YLDs in 2019.

hemolytic-disease-and-other-neonatal-jau.Indicator: Hemolytic disease and other neonatal jaundice
hemolytic-disease-and-other-neonatal-jau.Definition:
Elevated total serum bilirubin (TSB) as manifested by EHB (TSB >25 mg/dl) and kernicterus (bilirubin-induced brain injury). Underlying causes include Rhesus disease, prematurity, glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency, and other causes.
Neonatal haemolytic disease caused 52 700 deaths (95% UI 43 400–63 400) in 2019 (1·0% [0·9–1·2] of deaths under 5) and caused 0·3% (0·2–0·3) of YLDs among children and adolescents (<20 years).

other-neonatal-disorders-neonatalDisorde.Definition:
Causes of death and disability in the neonatal period (first 28 days of life) not separately defined in the GBD. The top three coded causes of death in this category are newborn haemorrhage, cardiovascular disorders, and consequences of maternal conditions.
Other neonatal disorders caused 373 000 deaths (95% UI 311 000–452 000) in 2019, making up 7·4% (6·7–8·0) of deaths under 5. Other neonatal disorders also caused 0·6% (0·5–0·8) of YLDs among children and adolescents (<20 years) in 2019.

nutritional-deficiencies-communicableMat.Definition:
This aggregate cause incorporates death and disability due to nutritional deficiencies including protein-energy malnutrition, iodine deficiency, vitamin A deficiency, iron deficiency, and other nutritional deficiencies.
Globally, nutritional deficiencies resulted in 49·8 million (36·9–65·8) DALYs and 252 000 deaths (221 000–289 000) in 2019. They caused 9·79 million (7·60–12·3) DALYs in children aged 1–5.
nutritional-deficiencies-communicableMat.Category: Communicable, maternal, neonatal, and nutritional diseases

protein-energy-malnutrition-nutritionalD.Definition:
Protein-energy malnutrition is health loss associated with moderate and severe acute wasting. PEM is further divided into moderate wasting without oedema, moderate wasting with oedema, severe wasting without oedema, and severe wasting with oedema.
Protein-energy malnutrition (PEM) caused 212 000 deaths (95% UI 185 000–246 000) in 2019, comprising 1·9% (1·5–2·2) of deaths among children under 5 years. PEM also caused 1·8% (1·4–2·2) of YLDs among children and adolescents (under 20 years).

iodine-deficiency-nutritionalDeficiencie.Definition:
This cause incorporates disability due to visible goiter (grade 2) and associated sequelae, including thyroid dysfunction, heart failure, and intellectual disability. Sub-clinical iodine deficiency and non-visible goiter (grade 1) are not incorporated into these estimates.
In 2019, iodine deficiency had a global prevalence of 2·4% (95% UI 1·9–2·9) and accounted for 2·44 million (1·37–4·24) DALYs globally. Iodine deficiency led to 919 000 DALYs (526 000–1 560 000) in males and 1·52 million (0·843–2·70) DALYs in females in 2019.

vitamin-a-deficiency-nutritionalDeficien.Definition:
This cause quantifies total vitamin A deficiency (defined as serum retinol <0.70 μmol/L) and disability from blindness and vision loss due to vitamin A deficiency.
In 2019, Vitamin A deficiency was responsible for 1·18 million (95% UI 0·805–1·64) DALYs globally, including 506 000 DALYs (337 000–720 000) in children under the age of 5.

intracerebral-hemorrhage-stroke.Definition:
Stroke was defined according to WHO criteria of rapidly developing clinical signs of (usually focal) disturbance of cerebral function lasting >24 hours or leading to death. Intracerebral haemorrhage was defined as stroke with a focal collection of blood in the brain not due to trauma.
In 2019, intracerebral haemorrhage was the sixth-leading Level 4 cause of global DALYs at 68·6 million (95% UI 63·3–73·7), causing 2·89 million (2·64–3·10) deaths. There were 582 000 deaths (530 000–632 000) for ages 40–59 years and 2·21 million (2·01–2·37) deaths in those 60 years and older.

subarachnoid-hemorrhage-stroke.Definition:
Subarachnoid haemorrhage was defined as non-traumatic stroke due to bleeding into the subarachnoid space of the brain. We model first-ever subarachnoid haemorrhage from the day of incidence through 28 days and separately model survival beyond 28 days.
In 2019, subarachnoid haemorrhage was the 53rd-leading cause of global DALYs at 11·2 million (95% UI 9·89–12·7), with 373 000 deaths (330 000–416 000). There were 103 000 deaths (88 600–122 000) among those aged 40–59 years and 240 000 deaths (211 000–263 000) in ages over 60.

hypertensive-heart-disease-cardiovascula.Definition:
Hypertensive heart disease is structural heart disease defined by its underlying cause (systemic hypertension), resulting in left ventricular hypertrophy, diastolic dysfunction, and clinical heart failure with either preserved or reduced systolic function.
Hypertensive heart disease resulted in 21·5 million (95% UI 16·4–23·9) global DALYs in 2019, and led to 496 000 deaths (345 000–558 000) in males and 661 000 deaths (505 000–750 000) in females.

cardiomyopathy-and-myocarditis-cardiovas.Definition:
This aggregate Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from cardiomyopathy and myocarditis. This group consists of the Level 4 causes alcoholic cardiomyopathy, myocarditis, and other cardiomyopathy.
Cardiomyopathy and myocarditis (CMP) was responsible for 9·14 million (95% UI 7·86–10·0) DALYs in 2019. In 2019, there were 2·30 million (1·78–2·94) prevalent cases of CMP in males and 1·76 million (1·35–2·30) prevalent cases in females.

atrial-fibrillation-and-flutter-cardiova.Definition:
Atrial fibrillation, a supraventricular arrhythmia due to progressive atriopathy, is defined by surface ECG diagnosis based on irregular RR intervals (in the absence of complete AV block) and no distinct P waves. Atrial flutter is defined by surface ECG diagnosis of atrial flutter waves.
There were 8·39 million (95% UI 6·69–10·5) DALYs due to atrial fibrillation and flutter in 2019, a 121·6% (111·5–132·0) increase from 1990. In 2019, there were 194 000 deaths (161 000–225 000) due to atrial fibrillation and flutter in females and 122 000 deaths (97 400–148 000) in males.

aortic-aneurysm-cardiovascularDiseases.Definition:
Aortic aneurysms represent full-thickness dilation of the aorta, usually due to atherosclerosis, elevated blood pressure, or inflammation of the blood vessel. We include both abdominal and thoracic aortic aneurysms in our estimates of cause-specific mortality.
Aortic aneurysm was responsible for 3·32 million (95% UI 3·11–3·52) YLLs in 2019. There were 172 000 (157 000–183 000) deaths due to aortic aneurysms in 2019, an 82·1% (67·3–97·0) increase from 1990. Non-fatal burden is not currently estimated for aortic aneurysm.

peripheral-artery-disease-cardiovascular.Definition:
Peripheral artery disease is a Level 3 cause defined as having an ankle-brachial index (ABI) of less than 0·90, with intermittent claudication defined as leg pain on exertion among those with an ABI below that threshold.
Peripheral artery disease (PAD) was responsible for 1·54 million (95% UI 1·01–2·37) DALYs in 2019. In 2019, there were 56·4 million (46·9–65·5) prevalent cases of PAD among those aged 40–70 and 57·0 million (95% UI 47·9–67·3) prevalent cases in those above age 70.

endocarditis-cardiovascularDiseases.Definition:
The case definition for acute endocarditis was a clinical diagnosis of infective endocarditis—a bacterial or fungal infection of the heart, usually adherent to heart valves or chordae. The long-term sequelae of heart failure due to endocarditis are reported separately.
Endocarditis accounted for 66 300 deaths (95% UI 46 200–75 900) in 2019, a 131% (57·6–189) increase from 1990. In 2019, there were 610 000 incident cases (514 000–719 000) of acute endocarditis in males and 480 000 incident cases (402 000–575 000) in females.

non-rheumatic-valvular-heart-disease-car.Definition:
Non-rheumatic valvular heart disease is an aggregate of three Level 4 causes: calcific aortic valve disease, degenerative mitral valve disease, and other non-rheumatic valve diseases.
Non-rheumatic valvular heart disease (NRVD) caused 2·79 million (95% UI 2·52–3·13) DALYs in 2019, a 67·6% (55·1–80·8) increase from 1990. In 2019, NRVD led to 68 100 deaths (61 100–73 300) in males and 96 000 deaths (78 400–108 000) in females.

communicable,-maternal,-neonatal,-and-nu.Indicator: Communicable, maternal, neonatal, and nutritional diseases
communicable,-maternal,-neonatal,-and-nu.Definition:
This aggregate cause contains seven Level 2 causes: HIV/AIDS and sexually-transmitted infections, respiratory infections and tuberculosis, enteric infections, neglected tropical diseases and malaria, other infectious diseases, maternal and neonatal disorders, and nutritional deficiencies.
CMNN diseases caused 10·2 million (95% UI 9·19–11·4) deaths, 669 million (593–758) DALYs, and 104 million (77·1–137) YLDs, in 2019 globally for all ages, which represented a 36·3% (29·1–42·3) decrease in deaths, a 44·4% (37·4–50·5) decrease in DALYs, and a 22·1% (18·2–26·8) increase in YLDs from 1990.

dietary-iron-deficiency-nutritionalDefic.Definition:
Dietary iron deficiency is defined as inadequate dietary intake of elemental iron leading to anaemia. Other conditions leading to iron deficiency are not included here, but instead with each underlying cause. Iron deficiency in the absence of anaemia is also not included.
In 2019, iron deficiency had a global prevalence of 14·4% (14·1–14·6) and accounted for 28·5 million (19·1–41·1) DALYs globally.

other-nutritional-deficiencies-nutrition.Definition:
This aggregate cause incorporates death and disability from less common nutritional deficiencies that are not modelled independently, including vitamin deficiency anaemias, thiamine, niacin, vitamin D, vitamin C, calcium, selenium, and folate deficiency.
Other nutritional deficiencies were responsible for 2·37 million (1·88–2·95) DALYs and 39 300 deaths (33 800–45 900) globally in 2019.

sexually-transmitted-infections-excludin.Definition:
STIs are viral, bacterial, or parasitic infections that are transmitted through sexual contact. This aggregate group includes syphilis, chlamydia, gonorrhoea, genital herpes, trichomoniasis, and a residual category of other sexually transmitted infections.
Sexually transmitted infections (STIs) that are not HIV resulted in 8·57 million (95% UI 3·79–16·5) global DALYs in 2019. Deaths from neonatal syphilis contributed 62·3% (47·9–70·4) of total DALYs in this category.

syphilis-sexuallyTransmittedInfectionsEx.Definition:
Syphilis is an STI caused by the bacterium Treponema pallidum. This cause includes congenital syphilis deaths, and, in adults, deaths and disability from the acute infection and neurological and cardiovascular sequelae in untreated individuals.
Syphilis resulted in 7·36 million (95% UI 2·58–15·0) DALYs in 2019. Congenital syphilis deaths accounted for 95·2% (89·5–98·1) of the total YLLs from all sexually transmitted infections (STIs) that are not HIV.

chlamydial-infection-sexuallyTransmitted.Definition:
Chlamydia is a sexually transmitted infection caused by the Chlamydia trachomatis bacteria. Severe infections can lead to epididymo-orchitis in males or pelvic inflammatory disease in females, which can lead to female infertility.
Chlamydia resulted in 160 000 global DALYs (95% UI 114 000–223 000) in 2019, accounting for 2·1% (0·9–4·4) of DALYs from all sexually transmitted infections excluding HIV.

gonococcal-infection-sexuallyTransmitted.Definition:
Gonorrhoea is a sexually transmitted infection caused by the Neisseria gonorrhoea bacterium. Severe infections can lead to epididymo-orchitis in males or pelvic inflammatory disease in females which can lead to female infertility.
Gonorrhoea resulted in 163 000 global DALYs (95% UI 133 000–195 000) in 2019, accounting for 2·2% (1·0–4·4) of DALYs from all sexually transmitted infections excluding HIV.

trichomoniasis-sexuallyTransmittedInfect.Definition:
Trichomoniasis is a sexually transmitted infection caused by the Trichomonas vaginalis bacterium. No mortality is assumed from this sexually transmitted infection.
Trichomoniasis resulted in 287 000 global DALYs (95% UI 113 000–592 000) in 2019, accounting for 3·8% (1·2–10·2) of DALYs from all sexually transmitted infections excluding HIV.

genital-herpes-sexuallyTransmittedInfect.Definition:
Herpes is a sexually transmitted infection caused by the herpes simplex virus (HSV). Estimates are for genital herpes due to HSV-2 only, not HSV-1 or oral herpes due to HSV-2. Disability reflects recurrent outbreaks over the life course. No mortality is assumed.
Genital herpes resulted in 253 000 global DALYs (95% UI 81 700–628 000) in 2019, accounting for 3·4% (0·9–9·1) of DALYs from all sexually transmitted infections excluding HIV.

other-sexually-transmitted-infections-se.Definition:
Other sexually transmitted infections is a residual category after exclusion of HIV, syphilis, chlamydia, gonorrhoea, herpes, and trichomoniasis. It comprises chancroid, granuloma inguinale, and unspecified sexually transmitted diseases.
Other sexually transmitted infections resulted in 345 000 global DALYs (95% UI 248 000–465 000) in 2019, which accounted for 4·6% (2·0–9·2) of DALYs from all sexually transmitted infections excluding HIV.

foreign-body-in-other-body-part-foreignB.Indicator: Foreign body in other body part
foreign-body-in-other-body-part-foreignB.Definition:
Unintentional death or disability resulting from an extraneous material or substance being within the body, not including the airway, lungs, or eyes.
Foreign body in other body part injury was responsible for 5460 deaths (95% UI 4580–6470) in 2019. Age-standardised incidence rates were highest in New Zealand, Australia, and South Africa.

other-unintentional-injuries-unintention.Definition:
Death or disability resulting from unintentional injuries not included in transport injuries or elsewhere in unintentional injuries. ICD10: W39-W39.9, W77-W77.9, W81-W81.9, X50-X58.9
Other unintentional injuries was responsible for 107 000 deaths (95% UI 83 300–119 000) in 2019. 62 200 deaths (48 200–70 000) occurred in the 15-49 year age group in 2019.

self-harm-and-interpersonal-violence-inj.Definition:
This cause includes death or disability from deliberate bodily damage inflicted on oneself or from intentional use of physical force or power from another person or group not including military or police forces.
Self-harm and interpersonal violence were responsible for 1·25 million (95% UI 1·16–1·33) deaths in 2019. 787 000 deaths (733 000–842 000) occurred in the 15–49 years age group, constituting 10·6% (10·0–11·2) of deaths for that population.

self-harm-selfHarmAndInterpersonalViolen.Definition:
Self-harm is deliberate bodily damage inflicted on oneself resulting in death or injury. ICD-9: E950–E959, ICD-10: X60–X64.9, X66–X84.9, Y87.0.
Self-harm caused 759 000 deaths (95% UI 685 000–832 000) in 2019 and 10·1% (9·2–11·1) of deaths in the 20–24 year age group. Age-standardised death rates decreased 16·5% (10·3–21·4) between 2010 and 2019. Self-harm was the 19th-leading Level 3 cause in terms of age-standardised death rate in 2019.

self-harm-by-firearm-selfHarm.Definition:
Death or disability inflicted by intentional use of a firearm on oneself.
Self-harm by firearm was responsible for 52 700 deaths (95% UI 46 300–61 900) in 2019. 27 600 deaths (24 100–33 300) occurred in the 15–49 years age group, constituting 0·4% (0·3–0·4) of all deaths and 0·4% (0·3–0·5) of YLLs for that population. 45 100 deaths (38 700–54 600) from self-harm by firearm globally were in males.

self-harm-by-other-specified-means-selfH.Definition:
Death or occurrence of deliberate bodily damage inflicted on oneself resulting in death by means of self-poisoning, medication overdose, transport, falling from height, hanging or strangulation, or other mechanisms not including firearms or sharp objects.
Self-harm by other specified means caused 706 000 deaths (95% UI 634 000–777 000) in 2019. The age-standardised mortality rate decreased from 10.5 per 100 000 (9·4–11·2) in 2010 to 8.7 per 100 000 (7·9–9·6) in 2019 and was highest in eastern Europe in 2019.

interpersonal-violence-selfHarmAndInterp.Definition:
GBD defines interpersonal violence as death or disability from intentional use of physical force or power, threatened or actual, from another person or group not including military or police forces. Included are ICD-9: E960–E969; ICD-10: X85–Y08.9, Y87.1–Y87.2.
Interpersonal violence was responsible for 415 000 deaths (95% UI 388 000–447 000) in 2019. 312 000 deaths (291 000–336 000) occurred in the 15–49 years age group, constituting 4·2% (4·0–4·5) of deaths and 4·6% (4·4–4·9) of YLLs for that population.

physical-violence-by-firearm-interperson.Definition:
Death or disability from intentional use of a firearm by another person, not including military or police forces.
Physical violence by firearm was responsible for 177 000 deaths (95% UI 164 000–193 000) in 2019. 148 000 deaths (137 000–160 000) occurred in the 15–49 years age group, constituting 2·0% (1·9–2·1) of deaths and 2·2% (2·1–2·4) of YLLs for that population. Physical violence by firearm was the 60th leading Level 4 cause in terms of age-standardised death rate in 2019.

physical-violence-by-sharp-object-interp.Definition:
Death or disability from intentional use of physical force or power by a sharp object from another person, not including military or police forces.
Physical violence by sharp object caused 98 400 deaths (95% UI 82 600–110 000) in 2019. Age-standardised mortality rate (ASMR) decreased from 1·4 per 100 000 (1·2–1·5) in 2010 to 1·2 per 100 000 (1·0–1·4) in 2019.

physical-violence-by-other-means-interpe.Definition:
Death or disability from intentional use of physical force or power by an object other than a firearm or sharp object from another person not including legal, military, or police forces.
