Physical violence by other means was responsible for 139 000 deaths (95% UI 127 000–153 000) in 2019. 89 400 deaths (81 000–99 000) occurred in the 15-49 years age group.

exposure-to-forces-of-nature-unintention.Definition:
A force that is beyond human control. This Includes earthquakes, volcanic eruptions, avalanches, storms, lightning strikes, and floods.
Exposure to forces of nature was responsible for 6080 deaths (95% UI 5520–6690) in 2019. Of these deaths, 2720 (2470–2990) occurred in locations with a low SDI and 219 deaths (199–241) occurred in locations with a high SDI.

maternal-deaths-aggravated-by-hiv/aids-m.Definition:
Maternal deaths aggravated by HIV/AIDS are deaths occurring in HIV-positive women whose pregnancy has exacerbated their HIV/AIDS, leading to death.
Maternal deaths aggravated by HIV/AIDS was responsible for 1590 deaths (95% UI 953–2290) among females ages 10 to 54, an 118% (67·0–183) increase since 1990.

hiv/aids-hivAidsAndSexuallyTransmittedIn.Definition:
The human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) causes influenza-like symptoms during the acute period following infection, and can lead to acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) if untreated. HIV attacks the immune system, leaving infected individuals more susceptible to opportunistic infections like tuberculosis. We do not distinguish between HIV-1 and HIV-2.
Globally in 2019, the number of HIV-related deaths was 864 000 (95% UI 786 000–996 000) and the number of new HIV infections was 1·99 million (1·76–2·26). The majority of this burden was seen in the sub-Saharan Africa super-region, which accounted for 74·0% (71·4–76·9) of global HIV-related deaths and 64·9% (61·1–69·1) of new HIV infections in 2019.

hiv/aids-resulting-in-other-diseases-hiv.Definition:
Deaths among HIV-positive people from diseases other than tuberculosis. This is computed by subtracting HIV/AIDS–tuberculosis deaths from all HIV deaths.
Globally in 2019, 35·0 million (95% UI 33·2–36·9) HIV-positive people experienced non-tuberculosis diseases. In the same year, there were 647 000 deaths (552 000–780 000) from HIV/AIDS resulting in diseases other than TB and 1·99 million (1·76–2·26) new cases.

diarrheal-diseases-entericInfections.Definition:
This aggregate cause incorporates death and disability resulting from diarrhoeal diseases for 13 different aetiologies. Diarrhoeal disease episodes were defined as three or more loose stools in a 24-hour period. Included are ICD-9: 001–009.9; ICD-10: A00–A09, R19.7.
In 2019, 6·58 billion (95% UI 6·05–7·14) incident cases and 99·0 million (92·1–106) prevalent cases of diarrhoeal diseases contributed to 1·53 million (1·09–2·22) deaths and 80·9 million (65·4–103) DALYs. The most DALYs occurred in children under 5 years (45·5 million [35·8–58·3]).

typhoid-fever-typhoidAndParatyphoid.Definition:
Typhoid fever results from systemic infection with Salmonella enterica serotype Typhi. It is characterised by febrile illness and, in severe cases, gastrointestinal bleeding, altered mental state, intestinal perforation, and death.
9·24 million (95% UI 5·94–14·1) cases of typhoid fever occurred in 2019, resulting in 110 000 deaths (52 800–191 000) and 8·05 million (3·86–13·9) DALYs.

paratyphoid-fever-typhoidAndParatyphoid.Definition:
Paratyphoid fever results from systemic infection with Salmonella enterica serotype Paratyphi. It is characterised by febrile illness and, in severe cases, gastrointestinal bleeding, altered mental status, intestinal perforation, and death.
3·80 million (95% UI 2·36–6·11) cases of paratyphoid fever occurred in 2019, resulting in 23 300 deaths (9800–45 700) and 1·64 million (0·682–3·21) DALYs.

other-intestinal-infectious-diseases-ent.Definition:
Other intestinal infectious diseases include intestinal infectious diseases other than diarrhoeal diseases, typhoid and paratyphoid, and invasive non-typhoidal Salmonella (iNTS).
Globally in 2019, there were 1400 deaths (95% UI 1000–1850) and 112 000 DALYs (79 200–149 000) due to other intestinal infectious diseases.

acute-hepatitis-otherInfectiousDiseases.Definition:
Hepatitis is a viral infection that can lead to inflammation of the liver. This Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from acute hepatitis A, B, C, and E.
Acute hepatitis resulted in 4·35 million (95% UI 3·57–5·22) global DALYs in 2019. Acute hepatitis A, B, C, and E contributed 53·9% (42·9–63·6), 37·2% (27·8–47·4), 5·8% (3·4–8·8), and 3·0% (2·1–4·0) to DALYs for the acute hepatitis parent, respectively.

acute-hepatitis-a-acuteHepatitis.Definition:
Hepatitis A is a viral infection that affects the liver. It is transmitted by faeco-oral route.
Acute hepatitis A resulted in 2·35 million (95% UI 1·70–3·09) global DALYs in 2019 and was responsible for 53·9% (42·9–63·6) of acute hepatitis DALYs.

acute-hepatitis-b-acuteHepatitis.Definition:
Hepatitis B is a viral infection of the liver. It can be transmitted during medical procedures, through unsafe injecting, sexually, and from mother to child.
Acute hepatitis B resulted in 1·61 million (95% UI 1·17–2·21) global DALYs in 2019 and was responsible for 37·2% (27·8–47·4) of acute hepatitis DALYs.

acute-hepatitis-c-acuteHepatitis.Definition:
Hepatitis C is a viral infection of the liver. It is transmitted through injecting needles and during medical procedures.
Acute hepatitis C resulted in 253 000 global DALYs (95% UI 145 000–375 000) in 2019 and was responsible for 5·8% (3·4–8·8) of acute hepatitis DALYs.

acute-hepatitis-e-acuteHepatitis.Definition:
Hepatitis E is a viral infection that affects the liver. It is transmitted by faeco-oral route.
Acute hepatitis E resulted in 131 000 global DALYs (95% UI 84 600–191 000) in 2019 and was responsible for 3·0% (2·1–4·0) of acute hepatitis DALYs.

leprosy-neglectedTropicalDiseasesAndMala.Definition:
The estimates for leprosy represent Grade 1 and Grade 2 cases. Grade 1 disability includes scarring or sensory impairment, and Grade 2 cases are characterised by ulcers, severe atrophy, or severe sensory impairment. 
The global burden of leprosy in 2019 was 28 800 DALYs (95% UI 18 600–42 000).

other-unspecified-infectious-diseases-ot.Definition:
Other unspecified infectious diseases include scarlet fever, other bacterial diseases, atypical viral infections of CNS, other viral infections, mononucleosis, rheumatic fever without heart involvement, other neonatal infections, and other infections in other organs.
Globally in 2019, there were 52·7 million (95% UI 51·7–53·6) prevalent cases of other unspecified infectious diseases, with 71 700 deaths (50 800–85 400).

non-communicable-diseases-allCauses.Definition:
This aggregate cause incorporates death and disability resulting from NCDs including cardiovascular diseases, musculoskeletal and mental disorders, and cancer as the largest contributing Level 2 cause groups.
Non-communicable diseases (NCDs) was responsible for 1·62 billion (95% UI 1·43–1·82) DALYs in 2019, an increase from 43·2% (40·4–45·7) of total DALYs in 1990 to 63·8% (61·4–66·0) of total DALYs in 2019.

thyroid-cancer-neoplasms.Definition:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the thyroid, including ICD-10 codes such as C73.
There were 234 000 incident cases (95% UI 212 000–253 000), 45 600 deaths (41 300–48 800), and 1·23 million (1·11–1·33) DALYs due to thyroid cancer globally in 2019.

mesothelioma-neoplasms.Definition:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the mesothelium, including ICD-10 codes such as C45.
There were 34 500 incident cases (95% UI 31 200–37 800), 29 300 deaths (26 700–31 000), and 668 000 DALYs (608 000–716 000) due to mesothelioma globally in 2019.

hodgkin-lymphoma-neoplasms.Definition:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the lymph system (specifically Hodgkin disease), including ICD-10 codes such as C81.
There were 87 500 incident cases (95% UI 77 900–101 000), 27 600 deaths (23 700–31 800), and 1·15 million (0·977–1·32) DALYs due to Hodgkin lymphoma globally in 2019.

non-hodgkin-lymphoma-neoplasms.Definition:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the lymph system (specifically non-Hodgkin lymphoma), including ICD-10 codes such as C82-C86.
There were 457 000 incident cases (95% UI 417 000–499 000), 255 000 deaths (238 000–270 000), and 6·99 million (6·57–7·45) DALYs due to non-Hodgkin lymphoma globally in 2019.

multiple-myeloma-neoplasms.Definition:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from malignant neoplasms of plasma cells, including ICD-10 codes such as C90.0.
There were 156 000 incident cases (95% UI 137 000–173 000), 113 000 deaths (99 500–122 000), and 2·50 million (2·19–2·72) DALYs due to multiple myeloma globally in 2019.

leukemia-neoplasms.Definition:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the blood and bone marrow (specifically leukaemia), including ICD-10 codes such as C91–C95.
There were 644 000 incident cases (95% UI 587 000–700 000), 335 000 deaths (307 000–360 000), and 11·7 million (10·5–12·7) DALYs due to leukaemia globally in 2019.

other-neoplasms-neoplasms.Definition:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from all non-malignant neoplasms of sites not captured by another GBD cancer cause, such as benign and in situ neoplasms and myelodysplastic, myeloproliferative, and other haemopoietic neoplasms.
There were 282 million (95% UI 236–341) incident cases, 56 800 deaths (46 600–70 500), and 1·22 million (1·04–1·47) DALYs due to other neoplasms globally in 2019.

cardiovascular-diseases-nonCommunicableD.Definition:
This aggregate cause incorporates death and disability resulting from 11 cardiovascular causes, led by ischaemic heart disease, stroke, and hypertensive heart disease, as well as disability due to heart failure. Both atherosclerotic and nonatherosclerotic cardiovascular diseases are included.
Cardiovascular diseases was responsible for 393 million (95% UI 368–417) DALYs in 2019, and was the leading Level 2 cause of disease burden. Overall, there were 18·6 million (17·1–19·7) deaths due to cardiovascular diseases in both sexes combined in 2019.

rheumatic-heart-disease-cardiovascularDi.Definition:
RHD is a chronic autoimmune valvulitis due to rheumatic fever resulting from streptococcal pharyngitis. We defined RHD as a clinical diagnosis by a physician. Screening studies using echocardiography followed the World Heart Federation criteria for RHD.
In 2019, there were 10·7 million (95% UI 9·21–12·1) DALYs due to rheumatic heart disease (RHD). There were 306 000 deaths (259 000–340 000) due to RHD in 2019, a 15·6% (2·12–30·5) decrease from 1990.

ischemic-heart-disease-cardiovascularDis.Definition: IHD is defined as disease of the coronary arteries, usually from atherosclerosis, leading to myocardial infarction (MI) or ischaemia, following the Fourth Universal In 2019, ischaemic heart disease (IHD) was the second-leading Level 3 cause of global DALYs at 182 million (95% UI 170–194), a 50·4% (39·9–60·2) increase from 1990. IHD was responsible for 9·14 million (8·40–9·74) global deaths in 2019.

stroke-cardiovascularDiseases.Definition:
Stroke was defined according to WHO criteria of rapidly developing clinical signs of usually focal disturbance of cerebral function lasting more than 24 hours or leading to death. This Level 3 aggregate cause incorporates multiple Level 4 subtypes of stroke.
Stroke caused 143 million (95% UI 133–153) DALYs in 2019, which was 5·7% (5·1–6·2) of DALYs globally, making it the third-leading Level 3 cause of disease burden. There were 3·33 million (3·04–3·62) stroke deaths in males and 3·22 million (2·86–3·54) deaths in females in 2019.

ischemic-stroke-stroke.Definition:
Stroke was defined according to WHO criteria of rapidly developing clinical signs of (usually focal) disturbance of cerebral function lasting >24 hours or leading to death. Ischaemic stroke is an episode of neurological dysfunction due to focal cerebral, spinal, or retinal infarction.
In 2019, ischaemic stroke was the cause of 63·5 million (95% UI 57·8–69·0) DALYs. Ischaemic stroke was responsible for 3·29 million (2·97–3·54) deaths in 2019, with 3·45 million (2·96–4·03) incident cases in males and 4·19 million (3·61–4·91) in females.

osteoarthritis-hip-osteoarthritis.Definition:
OA is the most common form of arthritis, involving chronic inflammation, breakdown, and structural alterations of the joint. The reference case definition is symptomatic osteoarthritis of the hip radiologically confirmed as Kellgren-Lawrence grade 2–4.
Osteoarthritis (OA) of the hip resulted in 1·03 million (95% UI 0·486–2·13) global YLDs in 2019 and was responsible for 0·1% (0·1–0·2) of total global YLDs. OA hip makes up 5·5% (4·2–6·9) of the burden of all sites of osteoarthritis.

osteoarthritis-knee-osteoarthritis.Definition:
OA is the most common form of arthritis, involving chronic inflammation, breakdown, and structural alterations of the joint. The reference case definition is symptomatic osteoarthritis of the knee radiologically confirmed as Kellgren-Lawrence grade 2–4.
Osteoarthritis (OA) of the knee resulted in 11·5 million (95% UI 5·72–23·4) global YLDs in 2019 and was responsible for 1·3% (0·8–2·5) of total global YLDs. OA knee makes up 60·8% (55·5–65·5) of the burden of all sites of osteoarthritis conditions.

osteoarthritis-other-osteoarthritis.Definition:
OA is the most common form of arthritis, involving chronic inflammation, breakdown, and structural alterations of the joint. The reference case definition was radiographically confirmed, symptomatic OA present in any joint other than those of the hand, hip, knee.
Osteoarthritis (OA) other resulted in 1·92 million (95% UI 0·939–4·01) global YLDs in 2019 and was responsible for 0·2% (0·1–0·4) of total global YLDs. OA other makes up 10·2% (7·6–12·9) of the burden of all osteoarthritis conditions.

liver-cancer-due-to-other-causes-liverCa.Indicator: Liver cancer due to other causes
liver-cancer-due-to-other-causes-liverCa.Definition:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the liver (specifically due to causes other than alcohol use, hepatitis B, hepatitis C, or NASH), including ICD-10 codes such as C22.0.
There were 28 500 incident cases (95% UI 23 600–34 100), 25 600 deaths (21 200–30 500), and 876 000 DALYs (749 000–1 020 000) from liver cancer due to other causes globally in 2019.

other-malignant-neoplasms-neoplasms.Definition:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from malignant neoplasms not included in any other GBD cause, including ICD-10 codes such as C17, C30, C31, C40, C41, C47, C48, C51–C52.9, C57, C60, C63, C66, C68, C69, and C74.
There were 831 000 incident cases (95% UI 741 000–906 000), 408 000 deaths (355 000–444 000), and 13·4 million (12·0–14·6) DALYs due to other malignant neoplasms in 2019.

other-cardiovascular-and-circulatory-dis.Definition:
This aggregate cause incorporates less common cardiovascular diseases that are not modelled independently.
In 2019, 8·76 million (95% UI 7·84–9·82) DALYs were due to cardiovascular and circulatory diseases not otherwise specified in GBD. There were 146 000 deaths (129 000–161 000) due to this cause among females and 131 000 deaths (118 000–147 000) among males.

total-burden-related-to-hepatitis-b-allC.Indicator: Total burden related to hepatitis B

total-burden-related-to-hepatitis-c-allC.Indicator: Total burden related to hepatitis C

total-burden-related-to-non-alcoholic-fa.Indicator: Total burden related to Non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD)

other-road-injuries-roadInjuries.Definition:
Death or disability resulting from being a driver or passenger of a vehicle not including automobiles, motorcycles, or bicycles (eg, streetcar).
Other road injuries was responsible for 12 100 deaths (95% UI 10 600–13 600) in 2019. 6010 deaths (5290–6770) occurred in the 15–49 year age group, constituting 0·08% (0·07–0·09) of deaths and 0·09% (0·08–0.10) of YLLs for that population.

other-transport-injuries-transportInjuri.Definition:
Death or disability due to injury sustained from transport other than automobile, motorcycle, pedal cycle, or other road vehicles.
Other transport injuries was responsible for 80 600 deaths (95% UI 67 600–89 000) in 2019. 45 000 deaths (37 500–50 300) occurred in the 15–49 years age group. There were 65 200 deaths (52 200–73 100) in males and 15 400 deaths (14 000–17 100) in females in 2019.

unintentional-injuries-injuries.Definition:
Death or bodily damage due to an injury that was unplanned or caused by external factors.
Unintentional injuries was responsible for 1·77 million (95% UI 1·55–1·95) deaths in 2019. The age-standardised death rate from unintentional injuries decreased from 30·3 per 100 000 (27·3–32·2) in 2010 to 23·1 per 100 000 (20·2–25·4) in 2019.

falls-unintentionalInjuries.Definition:
Falls includes death or disability resulting from a sudden movement downward due to slipping, tripping, or other unintentional movement that results in a person coming to rest at a lower level or against an object. Included are ICD-9: E880–E886.99, E888–E888.9, E929.3; ICD-10: W00–W19.9.
Falls was responsible for 753 000 deaths (95% UI 630 000–834 000) in 2019, an increase from 605 000 deaths (519 000–647 000) in 2010. Age-standardised death rates remained stable (decreased by 2·8% [-8·3 to 3·2]) between 2010 and 2019.

benign-and-in-situ-intestinal-neoplasms-.Indicator: Benign and in situ intestinal neoplasms
benign-and-in-situ-intestinal-neoplasms-.Definition:
This cause includes disability resulting from any non-invasive neoplasm of the intestines, including ICD-10 codes such as D01.0–D01.3, D12, K62.0–K62.1, and K63.5. No mortality is estimated for this cause.
There were 8·46 million (95% UI 6·57–10·6) incident cases due to benign and in situ intestinal neoplasms globally in 2019.

benign-and-in-situ-cervical-and-uterine-.Indicator: Benign and in situ cervical and uterine neoplasms
benign-and-in-situ-cervical-and-uterine-.Definition:
This cause includes disability resulting from any diagnosed non-invasive growth of the cervix or uterus, including ICD codes such as D06, D07.0, D26, and N84.0–N84.1. No mortality is estimated for this cause.
There were 2·30 million (95% UI 1·70–3·03) incident cases of benign and in situ cervical and uterine neoplasms globally in 2019.

other-benign-and-in-situ-neoplasms-other.Indicator: Other benign and in situ neoplasms
other-benign-and-in-situ-neoplasms-other.Definition:
This cause includes disability resulting from any diagnosed noninvasive neoplasm not specified as a part of another GBD cancer cause or impairment. No mortality is estimated for this cause.
There were 270 million (95% UI 225–330) incident cases due to other benign and in situ neoplasms globally in 2019.

non-rheumatic-calcific-aortic-valve-dise.Definition:
Calcific aortic valve disease was defined as clinical diagnosis of stenosis or regurgitation due to progressive calcification of the valve, excluding congenital, rheumatic, or infectious causes but including stenosis of a bicuspid aortic valve. We included hemodynamically moderate or severe stenosis or regurgitation.
Calcific aortic valve disease (CAVD) caused 1·84 million (95% UI 1·64–2·03) DALYs in 2019, an 88·3% (71·9–107) increase from 1990. In 2019, CAVD caused 54 200 deaths (47 800–58 700) in males and 72 700 deaths (57 800–84 300) in females.

non-rheumatic-degenerative-mitral-valve-.Definition:
Degenerative mitral valve disease was defined as myxomatous degeneration of the mitral valve leading to at least moderate mitral regurgitation, excluding disease due to congenital, rheumatic, or infectious causes.
Degenerative mitral valve disease (DMVD) led to 883 000 DALYs (95% UI 754 000–1 090 000) in 2019, a 41·2% (29·7–54·8) increase from 1990. In 2019, DMVD caused 12 700 deaths (9910–15 200) in males and 21 400 deaths (16 800–29 200) in females.

other-non-rheumatic-valve-diseases-nonRh.Definition:
Other non-rheumatic valve disease is a residual category capturing stenosis or regurgitation of the pulmonary or tricuspid valves, excluding valve dysfunction due to congenital, infectious, or rheumatic causes which were estimated separately.
Other non-rheumatic valve diseases (other NRVD) caused 72 600 DALYs (95% UI 55 600–85 300) in 2019, an 11·8% (–6·65 to 32·6) increase from 1990. In 2019, other NRVD led to 1210 male deaths (840–1520) and 1920 female deaths (1400–2250).

cirrhosis-and-other-chronic-liver-diseas.Indicator: Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases due to NAFLD
cirrhosis-and-other-chronic-liver-diseas.Category: Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases

headache-disorders-neurologicalDisorders.Definition:
This aggregate cause incorporates disability resulting from migraine, tension-type headache (TTH), and their complication of medication overuse headache.
Headache disorders was responsible for 46·6 million (95% UI 9·77–100) YLDs, or 5·4% (1·1–10·6) of total YLDs in 2019. Migraine headache made up 88·2% (60·7–97·7) of the burden of headache disorders.

hemoglobinopathies-and-hemolytic-anemias.Definition:
This aggregate cause includes sickle cell disorders, thalassaemias, glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency, sickle cell trait, thalassaemia trait, hemizygous G6PD deficiency, and other haemoglobinopathies and haemolytic anaemias.
Haemoglobinopathies and haemolytic anaemias was responsible for 92 800 deaths (95% UI 77 000–115 000) in 2019, with 23 200 (15 700–33 200) in children under 5 years. It also caused 7·77 million (5·15–11·4) YLDs, which made it the 30th-ranked Level 3 cause of YLDs.

thalassemias-hemoglobinopathiesAndHemoly.Definition:
Thalassaemias are defined by genotype and modelled as three separate entities: 1) beta-thalassaemia major, 2) haemoglobin E/beta-thalassaemia, and 3) haemoglobin H disease (genotype = - - / - alpha), which is the most severe form of alpha thalassaemia.
There were a total of 152 000 people (95 % UI 119 000–201 000) born with thalassaemias in 2019. Thalassaemias were responsible for 10 200 all-ages deaths (8580–12 000) in 2019, 3780 (3000–4730) of which were in children under 5.

sickle-cell-disorders-hemoglobinopathies.Definition:
SCD is defined by genotype and modelled as three separate entities: 1) homozygous sickle cell and severe sickle cell/beta-thalassaemia, 2) haemoglobin (Hb) SC disease, and 3) “mild” sickle cell-beta thalassaemia.
There were a total of 605 000 people (95% UI 466 000–781 000) born with sickle cell disorders (SCD) in 2019 and a total of 5·69 million (4·54–7·10) living with SCD. SCD was responsible for 41 900 all-ages deaths (29 500–57 900) in 2019.

g6pd-deficiency-hemoglobinopathiesAndHem.Definition:
G6PD deficiency is an X-linked recessive genetic disorder that is defined by reduced chemical activity of the G6PD enzyme.
There were a total of 8·96 million (95% UI 8·05–10·0) people born with glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency in 2019 and a total of 438 million (400–483) living with G6PD deficiency. G6PD deficiency was responsible for 13 000 all-ages deaths (9860–18 000) in 2019, 367 (225–568) of which were in children under 5.

other-hemoglobinopathies-and-hemolytic-a.Definition:
Other haemoglobinopathies and haemolytic anaemias include a number of blood disorders including inherited and acquired haemolytic anaemias, red cell aplasia, and aplastic anaemias.
Other haemoglobinopathies and haemolytic anaemias were responsible for 27 600 all-ages deaths (95% UI 23 900–32 500) in 2019, 74 (56–97) of which were in children under 5. They caused a total of 1·69 million (1·13–2·43) YLDs in 2019.

neck-pain-musculoskeletalDisorders.Definition:
Neck pain is defined as neck pain (with or without pain referred into the upper limb[s]) that lasts for at least one day. The “neck” includes the area from the occiput to the first thoracic vertebra.
Neck pain resulted in 22·1 million (95% UI 14·5–31·7) global YLDs in 2019 and was responsible for 2·6% (2·0–3·3) of total global YLDs.

gout-musculoskeletalDisorders.Definition:
Gout is a rheumatic disease that is characterised by deposition of monosodium urate (MSU) crystals in the synovial fluid of joints and in other tissues, causing inflammation. GBD uses the case definition of primary gout given by the American College of Rheumatology in 1977.
Gout resulted in 1·67 million (95% UI 1·07–2·39) global YLDs in 2019 and 0·2% (0·1–0·3) of total global YLDs.

other-musculoskeletal-disorders-musculos.Definition:
Other musculoskeletal disorders is a heterogeneous rest category comprising a wide range of disorders of muscles, bones, and ligaments that are not included in the five GBD defined musculoskeletal diseases (RA, OA, low back and neck pain, and gout).
Other musculoskeletal disorders (MSK) resulted in 40·4 million (95% UI 28·2–55·5) global DALYs in 2019 and were responsible for 1·6% (1·2–2·1) of total global DALYs. 95·0% (92·7–96·6) of other MSK DALYs were years lived with disability (YLDs).

other-non-communicable-diseases-nonCommu.Definition:
This aggregate cause contains seven Level 3 causes: 1) congenital birth defects, 2) urinary diseases, 3) gynaecological diseases, 4) haemoglobinopathies and haemolytic anaemias, 5) endocrine, metabolic, blood, and immune disorders, 6) oral disorders, and 7) SIDS.
In 2019, other non-communicable diseases caused 1·14 million (95% UI 1·01–1·30) deaths, 87·5 million (60·5–123) YLDs, and 153 million (124–187) DALYs globally for all ages.

cirrhosis-and-other-chronic-liver-diseas.Indicator: Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases
cirrhosis-and-other-chronic-liver-diseas.Definition:
Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases are conditions in which liver cells are destroyed and replaced by fibrosis. Decompensated cirrhosis occurs when the liver can no longer compensate for the damage, and is marked by profound symptoms, health loss, and typically death in a few years.
Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases resulted in 46·2 million (95% UI 43·0–49·6) global DALYs in 2019 and 1·8% (1·6–2·0) of global DALYs. Alcohol and hepatitis B and C contributed 24·2% (20·5–28·1), 23·3% (19·9–26·9), and 26·3% (22·9–30·5) of DALYs from cirrhosis, respectively.

cirrhosis-and-other-chronic-liver-diseas.Indicator: Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases due to hepatitis B
cirrhosis-and-other-chronic-liver-diseas.Definition:
Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases due to hepatitis B includes conditions in which there is progressive destruction of functional hepatic cells and replacement with fibrosis of the liver from hepatitis virus.
Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases due to hepatitis B resulted in 10·8 million (95% UI 8·99–12·7) global DALYs in 2019 and was responsible for 23·3% (19·9–26·9) of cirrhosis DALYs.
cirrhosis-and-other-chronic-liver-diseas.Category: Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases

cirrhosis-and-other-chronic-liver-diseas.Indicator: Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases due to hepatitis C
cirrhosis-and-other-chronic-liver-diseas.Definition:
Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases due to hepatitis C includes conditions in which there is progressive destruction of functional hepatic cells and replacement with fibrosis of the liver from hepatitis virus.
Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases due to hepatitis C resulted in 12·2 million (95% UI 10·3–14·2) global DALYs in 2019 and was responsible for 26·3% (22·9–30·5) of cirrhosis DALYs.
cirrhosis-and-other-chronic-liver-diseas.Category: Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases

cirrhosis-and-other-chronic-liver-diseas.Indicator: Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases due to alcohol use
cirrhosis-and-other-chronic-liver-diseas.Definition:
Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases due to alcohol use includes conditions in which there is progressive destruction of hepatic cells and replacement with fibrosis from alcohol consumption.
Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases due to alcohol use resulted in 11·2 million (95% UI 9·45–13·1) global DALYs in 2019.
cirrhosis-and-other-chronic-liver-diseas.Category: Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases

cirrhosis-and-other-chronic-liver-diseas.Indicator: Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases due to other causes
cirrhosis-and-other-chronic-liver-diseas.Definition:
This cause includes cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases due to causes other than hepatitis B, hepatitis C, alcohol, and NAFLD.
Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases due to other causes resulted in 8·44 million (95% UI 6·94–10·2) global DALYs in 2019.
cirrhosis-and-other-chronic-liver-diseas.Category: Cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases

genital-prolapse-gynecologicalDiseases.Definition:
Genital prolapse is defined as the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists (ACOG) criteria, characterised by descent of one or more of the female pelvic structures, including the uterus, bladder, rectum, small or large bowel, or vagina.
Genital prolapse caused a total of 2040 deaths (95% UI 1040–3350) globally in 2019. 3·1% (2·6–3·7) of all women—a total of 121 million (101–145) persons—were living with genital prolapse in 2019.

premenstrual-syndrome-gynecologicalDisea.Definition:
PMS is defined according to American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists (ACOG) diagnostic criteria requiring >1 emotional or physical symptom in the five days before menses (and remission <4 days after menses onset), with no recurrence at least until day 13 of the cycle, in each of three prior menstrual cycles.
Premenstrual syndrome (PMS) affected 24·8% (20·4–29·1) of all women, or 956 million (786–1120) persons, globally in 2019.

other-gynecological-diseases-gynecologic.Definition:
Other gynaecological disorders are menstrual disorders and non-menstrual disorders, including absent, scanty, and rare menstruation, pain, and other conditions; and inflammatory and non-inflammatory diseases of the breast, ovaries, and cervix.
Other gynaecological disorders caused a total of 2310 deaths (95% UI 1250–2760) globally in 2019. 15·0% (12·8–17·5) of all women—a total of 579 million (493–675) persons—were living with other gynaecological disorders in 2019.

substance-use-disorders-nonCommunicableD.Definition:
This aggregate cause incorporates death and disability resulting from drug and alcohol use disorders.
Substance use disorders was responsible for 35·1 million (95% UI 28·2–42·9) DALYs, or 1·4% (1·2–1·6) of total DALYs in 2019. Alcohol use disorders caused 48·4% (43·6–53·2) and drug use disorders 51·6% (46·8–56·4) of DALYs due to substance use disorders.

diabetes-and-kidney-diseases-nonCommunic.Definition:
This aggregate category consists of types 1 and 2 diabetes and of CKD due to these causes: hypertension, glomerulonephritis, other and unspecified causes, type 1 diabetes, and type 2 diabetes. Both types of diabetes are important aetiologies of CKD.
This aggregate disease category resulted in 113 million (95% UI 99·3–128) global DALYs in 2019 and was responsible for 4·4% (4·2–4·7) of total global DALYs. Diabetes contributed 62·9% and chronic kidney disease (CKD) contributed 37·1% of total DALYs in this category.

diabetes-mellitus-type-1-diabetesMellitu.Definition:
Type 1 diabetes is a chronic, autoimmune condition more commonly starting in childhood, in which the pancreas produces little or no insulin. GBD defines type 1 diabetics as persons who are diagnosed by physicians and identified through a diabetic registry or hospital records.
Type 1 diabetes resulted in 4·58 million (95% UI 3·91–5·38) global DALYs in 2019 and was responsible for 0·2% (0·2–0·2) of total global DALYs. Global DALYs for type 1 diabetes contributed to 6·5% (6·4–6·6) of total diabetes burden.

diabetes-mellitus-type-2-diabetesMellitu.Definition:
Type 2 diabetes is a chronic condition, mostly in adults, where the body forms a resistance to insulin or the pancreas stops producing enough insulin. GBD defines type 2 diabetes as fasting plasma glucose ≥ 7 mmol/L (126 mg/dL) or those currently treated with drugs or insulin.
Type 2 diabetes resulted in 66·3 million (95% UI 55·5–79·0) global DALYs in 2019 and was responsible for 2·6% (2·3–2·9) of total global DALYs. Global DALYs for type 2 diabetes contributed 93·5% of the total diabetes burden.

atopic-dermatitis-dermatitis.Definition:
Atopic dermatitis is a relapsing dermatitis associated with elevated serum immunoglobulin E and some degree of immune dysregulation; it can be localised or widespread and is commonly characterised by itching that can be extreme.
Globally, atopic dermatitis was responsible for 7·48 million (95% UI 3·99–12·6) DALYs and 24·4 million (23·3–25·6) incident cases in 2019.

contact-dermatitis-dermatitis.Definition:
Contact dermatitis is a localised dermatitis caused by direct contact with allergens or irritants; it can be asymptomatic or characterised by itching, stinging, or pain.
Globally, contact dermatitis was responsible for 2·28 million (95% UI 1·43–3·40) DALYs and 249 million (195–305) incident cases in 2019.

seborrhoeic-dermatitis-dermatitis.Definition:
Seborrhoeic dermatitis is a dermatitis affecting the sebaceous-gland-rich areas of skin, and it may cause itching (ICD-10: L21).
Globally, seborrhoeic dermatitis was responsible for 308 000 DALYs (95% UI 176 000–489 000) and 145 million (133–156) incident cases in 2019.

bacterial-skin-diseases-skinAndSubcutane.Definition:
This aggregate cause includes death and disability resulting from cellulitis and pyoderma. Pyoderma refers to any skin disease that is pyogenic, and cellulitis is a skin disease marked by a bacterial infection that affects and spreads through the skin and soft tissues.
Globally, bacterial skin diseases were responsible for 2·20 million (95% UI 1·66–2·64) DALYs in 2019, with 551 000 (378 000–660 000) DALYs from cellulitis and 1·65 million (1·25–2.01) DALYs from pyoderma.

blindness-and-vision-loss-senseOrganDise.Definition:
Blindness and vision loss is a GBD cause aggregate of vision loss due to glaucoma, cataract, macular degeneration, refractive errors, near vision loss, and other eye diseases not estimated as part of another GBD cause.
Blindness and vision loss resulted in 22·6 million (95% UI 15·6–31·7) global YLDs in 2019 and was responsible for 2·6% (2·2–3·2) of total global YLDs.

intestinal-nematode-infections-neglected.Definition:
Infections with intestinal nematodes, also known as soil-transmitted helminths, are caused by intestinal parasites: ascariasis (Ascaris lumbricoides), trichuriasis (Trichuris trichiura), and hookworm disease (Ancylostoma duodenale and Necator americanus). We model mortality due to ascariasis and non-fatal burden for all three helminthic diseases.
The global burden of intestinal nematode infections in 2019 was 2090 deaths (95% UI 1640–2640) and 1·97 million (1·26–3·00) DALYs.

ascariasis-intestinalNematodeInfections.Definition:
Ascariasis is a helminthic disease caused by the parasitic roundworm Ascaris lumbricoides. Diagnosis is made by examination of stool, with or without concentration procedures. The ICD-10 codes for ascariasis are B77–B77.9.
The global burden of ascariasis in 2019 was 754 000 DALYs (95% UI 479 000–1 140 000) and a total of 2090 deaths (1640–2640).

trichuriasis-intestinalNematodeInfection.Definition:
Trichuriasis is a helminthic disease caused by Trichuris trichiura. Diagnosis is made by examination of stool, with or without concentration procedures.  
The global burden of trichuriasis in 2019 was 236 000 DALYs (95% UI 126 000–402 000).

hookworm-disease-intestinalNematodeInfec.Definition:
Hookworm is a helminthic disease caused by Ancylostoma duodenale and Necator americanus. Diagnosis is made by examination of stool, with or without concentration procedures. 
The global burden of hookworm disease in 2019 was 984 000 DALYs (95% UI 626 000–1 470 000).

food-borne-trematodiases-neglectedTropic.Definition:
Our estimates represent infections with parasitic worms of the class trematode. We model infection and symptomatic illness for clonorchiasis, fascioliasis, fasciolopsiasis (intestinal fluke), opisthorichiasis, and paragonimiasis. 
Foodborne trematodiases were responsible for 780 000 DALYs (386 000–1 450 000) in 2019. They were the highest-ranking neglected tropical disease in east Asia in 2019.

non-melanoma-skin-cancer-neoplasms.Definition:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the skin, including ICD-10 codes such as C44. All deaths were mapped to squamous-cell carcinoma, while incident cases coded to C44 but without morphology codes were proportionally split to basal-cell and squamous-cell carcinoma.
There were 6·35 million (95% UI 5·81–6·95) incident cases, 56 100 deaths (50 400–59 800), and 1·18 million (1·09–1·26) DALYs due to non-melanoma skin cancer globally in 2019.

ovarian-cancer-neoplasms.Definition:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from malignant neoplasms of the ovaries, including ICD-10 codes such as C56.
There were 294 000 incident cases (95% UI 261 000–330 000), 198 000 deaths (175 000–218 000), and 5·36 million (4·69–5·95) DALYs due to ovarian cancer globally in 2019. Among females, ovarian cancer ranked as the 26th leading cause of death globally in 2019.

testicular-cancer-neoplasms.Definition:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the testes, including ICD-10 codes such as C62.
There were 109 000 incident cases (95% UI 93 400–129 000), 10 800 deaths (9960–11 900), and 562 000 DALYs (511 000–628 000) due to testicular cancer globally in 2019.

kidney-cancer-neoplasms.Definition:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from malignant neoplasms of the kidneys, including ICD-10 codes such as C64 and C65.
There were 372 000 incident cases (95% UI 345 000–402 000), 166 000 deaths (155 000–176 000), and 4·05 million (3·80–4·32) DALYs due to kidney cancer globally in 2019.

bladder-cancer-neoplasms.Definition:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from malignant neoplasms of the bladder, including ICD-10 codes such as C67.
There were 524 000 incident cases (95% UI 476 000–569 000), 229 000 deaths (211 000–243 000), and 4·39 million (4·09–4·70) DALYs due to bladder cancer globally in 2019.

brain-and-central-nervous-system-cancer-.Indicator: Brain and central nervous system cancer
brain-and-central-nervous-system-cancer-.Definition:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from malignant neoplasms of the brain and central nervous system, including ICD-10 codes such as C70–C72.9.
There were 348 000 incident cases (95% UI 262 000–389 000), 246 000 deaths (186 000–271 000), and 8·66 million (6·72–9·57) DALYs due to brain and central nervous system cancer globally in 2019.

myelodysplastic,-myeloproliferative,-and.Indicator: Myelodysplastic, myeloproliferative, and other hematopoietic neoplasms
myelodysplastic,-myeloproliferative,-and.Definition:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from neoplasms of the blood, including ICD-10 codes such as D46.
There were 402 000 incident cases (95% UI 342 000–476 000), 56 800 deaths (46 600–70 500), and 1·22 million (1·04–1·47) DALYs due to myelodysplastic, myeloproliferative, and other haemopoietic neoplasms globally in 2019.

multidrug-resistant-tuberculosis-without.Indicator: Multidrug-resistant tuberculosis without extensive drug resistance
multidrug-resistant-tuberculosis-without.Definition:
Multidrug-resistant TB without extensive drug resistance (among HIV-negative individuals) is a form of TB that does not respond to the two most effective first-line antituberculosis drugs, but is not resistant to any fluoroquinolone and any second-line injectable drugs.
Globally in 2019, among HIV-negative individuals, 451 000 incident cases (95% UI 248 000–785 000) of tuberculosis were multidrug-resistant, with 110 000 deaths (43 600–210 000).

extensively-drug-resistant-tuberculosis-.Definition:
Extensively drug-resistant tuberculosis is a form of TB (among HIV-negative individuals) that is not responsive to isoniazid and rifampicin, plus any fluoroquinolone and any second-line injectable drugs.
Globally in 2019, among HIV-negative individuals, we estimated that 25 100 incident cases (95% UI 17 100–36 500) of tuberculosis (TB) were extensively drug-resistant and 8500 deaths (4000–15 200) were due to extensively drug-resistant tuberculosis.

hiv/aids---drug-susceptible-tuberculosis.Definition:
Drug-susceptible tuberculosis (among HIV-positive individuals) is distinguished as being responsive to isoniazid and rifampicin treatment.
Among HIV-positive individuals, there were an estimated 1·10 million (95% UI 0·968–1·26) incident cases of tuberculosis that were drug-susceptible and 197 000 deaths (139 000–256 000) due to drug-susceptible tuberculosis in 2019.

hiv/aids---multidrug-resistant-tuberculo.Indicator: HIV/AIDS - Multidrug-resistant Tuberculosis without extensive drug resistance
hiv/aids---multidrug-resistant-tuberculo.Definition:
A form of TB among HIV-positive individuals that is not responsive to isoniazid and rifampicin, but is not resistant to any fluoroquinolone and any second-line injectable drugs.
Globally in 2019, among HIV-positive individuals, there were an estimated 47 700 incident cases (33 500–67 500) of MDR-TB.

hiv/aids---extensively-drug-resistant-tu.Definition:
Extensively drug-resistant tuberculosis is a form of TB (among HIV-positive individuals) that is not responsive to isoniazid and rifampicin, plus any fluoroquinolone and any second-line injectable drugs.
Globally in 2019, among HIV-positive individuals, we estimated that 1710 incident cases (95% UI 1220–2360) of tuberculosis (TB) were extensively drug-resistant and 807 deaths (347–1480) were due to extensively drug-resistant tuberculosis.

latent-tuberculosis-infection-tuberculos.Definition:
Latent tuberculosis infection is defined as an infection with Mycobacterium tuberculosis, without any symptoms or signs of active tuberculosis disease.
Globally in 2019, we estimated that 1·82 billion individuals (95% UI 1·65–2·00), representing 23·5% (21·4–25·8) of the global population, were latently infected with Mycobacterium tuberculosis.

hiv/aids-and-sexually-transmitted-infect.Definition:
HIV/AIDS and STIs are estimated separately, then combined in the GBD cause hierarchy in order to clearly represent the total burden attributable to STIs.
97·2% (95% UI 95·6–98·1) of DALYs in this aggregated group were attributable to HIV/AIDS, and 2·8% (1·9–4·4) were attributable to sexually transmitted infections (STIs). The majority of this burden was in sub-Saharan Africa.
hiv/aids-and-sexually-transmitted-infect.Category: Communicable, maternal, neonatal, and nutritional diseases

respiratory-infections-and-tuberculosis-.Definition:
Respiratory infections and tuberculosis are estimated separately, then combined in the GBD cause hierarchy. This cause includes lower respiratory infections, TB among HIV-negative individuals, latent TB, upper respiratory infections, and otitis media.
Respiratory infections and tuberculosis resulted in 153 million (95% UI 137–172) DALYs and 3·68 million (3·38–4·01) deaths in 2019. Burden was greatest in sub-Saharan Africa with 60·2 million (50·2–71·8) DALYs, or 11·8% (10·4–13·1) of total global DALYs.
respiratory-infections-and-tuberculosis-.Category: Communicable, maternal, neonatal, and nutritional diseases

enteric-infections-communicableMaternalN.Definition:
This aggregate cause incorporates death and disability resulting from infections to the intestines caused by a variety of different aetiologies including diarrhoeal diseases, typhoid and paratyphoid, and invasive nontyphoidal salmonella (iNTS).
There were 6·60 billion (95% UI 6·07–7·16) incident cases and 98·8 million (92·0–106) prevalent cases of enteric infections in 2019, contributing to 1·75 million (1·29–2·42) deaths, and 96·8 million (79·2–120) DALYs.
enteric-infections-communicableMaternalN.Category: Communicable, maternal, neonatal, and nutritional diseases

typhoid-and-paratyphoid-entericInfection.Definition:
Typhoid and paratyphoid fevers result from systemic infection with Salmonella enterica serotypes Typhi and Paratyphi, respectively. They are characterised by febrile illness and, if severe, gastrointestinal bleeding, altered mental status, intestinal perforation, and death.
13·0 million (95% UI 8·37–19·6) cases of typhoid and paratyphoid fever occurred in 2019, resulting in 133 000 (65 700–229 000) deaths and 9·69 million (4·69–16·7) DALYs.

invasive-non-typhoidal-salmonella-(ints).Definition:
Non-typhoidal Salmonella (NTS) infections usually result in self-limiting diarrhoeal illness. iNTS occurs when NTS invades a normally sterile site (eg, blood) and most commonly presents as febrile illness with high case fatality.
594 000 cases (95% UI 486 000–718 000) of iNTS occurred in 2019, resulting in 79 000 deaths (43 000–124 000) and 6·11 million (3·32–9·71) global DALYs.

other-infectious-diseases-communicableMa.Definition:
This aggregate cause incorporates death and disability resulting from meningitis, encephalitis, diphtheria, whooping cough, tetanus, measles, varicella, acute hepatitis, and a residual category of other infectious diseases.
Other infectious diseases were responsible for 730 000 deaths (95% UI 605 000–905 000), or 1·3% (1·1–1·6) of total deaths in 2019.
other-infectious-diseases-communicableMa.Category: Communicable, maternal, neonatal, and nutritional diseases

maternal-and-neonatal-disorders-communic.Definition:
This aggregate cause group includes 1) maternal disorders which are complications of pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium, and 2) neonatal complications of poor fetal development, birth injuries, and clinical syndromes unique to the perinatal period.
In 2019, maternal and neonatal disorders caused 2·08 million (95% UI 1·78–2·45) deaths, 20·0 million (15·9–24·2) YLDs, and 199 million (172–232) DALYs globally for all ages. This represented a 42·0% (31·1–50·9) decrease in deaths since 1990.
maternal-and-neonatal-disorders-communic.Category: Communicable, maternal, neonatal, and nutritional diseases

other-neglected-tropical-diseases-neglec.Definition:
Other NTDs includes diseases encompassed by a total of 93 ICD-10 codes. The most prevalent conditions in this category are other viral haemorrhagic fevers (eg, Crimean-Congo and Marburg), mosquito-borne viruses (Chikungunya or West Nile), and typhus.
The global burden of other neglected tropical diseases (NTDs) in 2019 is 2·80 million (95% UI 1·93–4·47) DALYs, with the highest burden in India with 830 000 DALYs (95% UI 576 000–1 140 000).

maternal-disorders-maternalAndNeonatalDi.Definition:
Fatal or non-fatal complications occurring during pregnancy, childbirth, and the postpartum period. Maternal deaths are due to obstetric complications or existing disorders exacerbated by pregnancy, up to one year post-pregnancy, excluding accidental and incidental deaths.
Maternal disorders was responsible for 196 000 deaths (95% UI 171 000–226 000) among females aged 10–54 in 2019, a 35·1% (25·4–45·4) decrease since 1990. There were 112 million (99·3–126) incident cases of maternal disorders in 2019, an 8·7% (5·9–11·3) decrease since 1990.

maternal-hemorrhage-maternalDisorders.Definition:
Maternal haemorrhage includes both postpartum haemorrhage (defined as blood loss >500 ml for vaginal delivery and >1000 ml for cesarean delivery) and antepartum haemorrhage (defined as vaginal bleeding from any cause at or beyond 20 weeks of gestation).
Maternal haemorrhage was responsible for 46 500 deaths (95% UI 40 300–54 100) among females ages 10 to 54, a 51·1% (42·0–59·3) decrease since 1990. There were 14·9 million (11·7–18·8) incident cases in 2019, a 4·7% (–0.0028 to 9·4) decrease since 1990.

maternal-sepsis-and-other-maternal-infec.Indicator: Maternal sepsis and other maternal infections
maternal-sepsis-and-other-maternal-infec.Definition:
Maternal sepsis is defined as a temperature <36°C or >38°C and clinical signs of shock (systolic blood pressure <90 mmHg and tachycardia >120 bpm). Other maternal infections are defined as any maternal infections excluding HIV, STI, or not related to pregnancy.
Maternal sepsis and other maternal infections were responsible for 16 800 deaths (95% UI 14 200–19 600) among females ages 10 to 54, a 55·7% (47·5–63·8) decrease since 1990. There were 20.6 million (15.7 - 26.0) incident cases of maternal sepsis and other maternal infections in 2019.

maternal-hypertensive-disorders-maternal.Definition:
Maternal hypertensive disorders—elevated blood pressure (BP >140/90) in the absence of a hypertension diagnosis prior to pregnancy (multiple measurements). They include gestational hypertension, pre-eclampsia, severe pre-eclampsia, and eclampsia.
Maternal hypertensive disorders were responsible for 27 800 deaths (95% UI 24 300–31 600) among females ages 10 to 54, a 30·0% (19·1–40·5) decrease since 1990. There were 18.1 million (15.3–21.1) incident cases of maternal hypertensive disorders in 2019.

maternal-obstructed-labor-and-uterine-ru.Indicator: Maternal obstructed labor and uterine rupture
maternal-obstructed-labor-and-uterine-ru.Definition:
No advance of the presenting part of the fetus despite strong uterine contractions, fetal size that is too large for maternal pelvic dimensions, or any fetal position besides head-down during labour.
Maternal obstructed labour and uterine rupture was responsible for 10 500 deaths (95% UI 8830–12 500) among females ages 10 to 54, a 26·2% (0·9–53·7) increase since 1990. There were 9·41 million (7·56–11·7) incident cases of maternal obstructed labour in 2019.

ectopic-pregnancy-maternalDisorders.Definition:
Ectopic pregnancy is defined as pregnancy occurring outside of the uterus.
Ectopic pregnancy was responsible for 6450 deaths (95% UI 5500–7510) among females ages 10 to 54, a 12·2% (-6·1 to 31·8) increase since 1990. There were a total of 6·69 million (5·23–8·60) ectopic pregnancies globally in 2019, a 10·2% (4·0–15·9) decrease since 1990.

indirect-maternal-deaths-maternalDisorde.Definition:
Indirect maternal deaths are due to existing diseases that are exacerbated by pregnancy. Examples include maternal infections and parasitic diseases complicating pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium, and diabetes in pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium.
Indirect maternal deaths was responsible for 25 200 deaths (95% UI 21 700–29 000) among females ages 10 to 54, an 18·2% (–1·5 to 39·3) increase since 1990.

late-maternal-deaths-maternalDisorders.Definition:
Late maternal deaths are deaths that occur six weeks to one year after the end of pregnancy, excluding incidental deaths.
Late maternal deaths were responsible for 13 200 deaths (95% UI 10 300–16 700) among females ages 10 to 54, a 33·3% (10·8–57·3) increase since 1990.

neonatal-disorders-maternalAndNeonatalDi.Definition:
This aggregate cause covers five main causes of death and disability: preterm birth complications; neonatal encephalopathy due to birth asphyxia and trauma; neonatal sepsis and other neonatal infections; haemolytic disease and other neonatal jaundice; and other neonatal disorders.
Neonatal disorders were responsible for 1·88 million (1·61–2·24) deaths in 2019, making up 37·3% (35·6–38·8) of deaths in children under 5 years. Neonatal disorders were the second-leading Level 3 cause of YLDs among children and adolescents (<20 years).

neonatal-preterm-birth-neonatalDisorders.Definition:
Preterm birth is defined as livebirth before 37 completed weeks of gestation. Preterm birth is subdivided into extremely preterm birth (<28 weeks), very preterm birth (28 to <32 weeks), and moderate-to-late preterm birth (32 to <37 weeks).
Neonatal preterm birth caused 664 000 deaths (95% UI 561 000–789 000) in 2019, comprising 13·2% (12·5–13·9) of deaths under 5. It also caused 3·3% (2·5–4·4) of YLDs among children and adolescents (<20 years), making it the sixth-ranked Level 4 cause of disability.

neonatal-encephalopathy-due-to-birth-asp.Indicator: Neonatal encephalopathy due to birth asphyxia and trauma
neonatal-encephalopathy-due-to-birth-asp.Definition:
Injury to the brain in the first days of life in a full-term infant, causing abnormal neurological function.
Neonatal encephalopathy caused 567 000 deaths (95% UI 476 000–673 000) in 2019, 11·2% (10·3–12·1) of deaths under 5.

neonatal-sepsis-and-other-neonatal-infec.Indicator: Neonatal sepsis and other neonatal infections
neonatal-sepsis-and-other-neonatal-infec.Definition:
Neonatal sepsis and other neonatal infections includes systemic bloodstream infections occurring during the neonatal period as well as other infections occurring during the neonatal period not otherwise modelled in the GBD study.
Neonatal sepsis caused 227 000 deaths (95% UI 190 000–276 000) in 2019, making up 4·5% (4·1–4·9) of deaths under 5. Neonatal sepsis also caused 1·3% (0·8–2·0) of YLDs among children and adolescents (<20 years).

rabies-neglectedTropicalDiseasesAndMalar.Definition:
Rabies is a viral infection transmitted by animal bite. We model symptomatic infections, not including those infections in which intervention prevented the onset of disease (ICD-10 code A82). Deaths due to rabies are reported via vital registration and verbal autopsy sources.
Rabies was responsible for 13 700 deaths (95% UI 6020–17 900) and 782 000 DALYs (320 000–1 080 000) in 2019.

other-pharynx-cancer-neoplasms.Definition:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the pharynx (specifically other pharynx cancers not included in the GBD causes for mouth and nasopharynx cancer, such as cancers of the tonsils, oropharynx, and hypopharynx).
There were 167 000 incident cases (95% UI 153 000–180 000), 114 000 deaths (103 000–126 000), and 3·23 million (2·90–3·57) DALYs due to other pharynx cancer globally in 2019.

gallbladder-and-biliary-tract-cancer-neo.Definition:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the gallbladder and biliary tract, including ICD-10 codes such as C23 and C24.
There were 199 000 incident cases (95% UI 167 000–220 000), 172 000 deaths (145 000–189 000), and 3·62 million (3·10–3·97) DALYs due to gallbladder and biliary tract cancer globally in 2019.

pancreatic-cancer-neoplasms.Definition:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from malignant neoplasms of the pancreas, including ICD-10 codes such as C25.
There were 530 000 incident cases (95% UI 486 000–574 000), 531 000 deaths (492 000–567 000), and 11·5 million (10·8–12·3) DALYs due to pancreatic cancer globally in 2019.

malignant-skin-melanoma-neoplasms.Definition:
This cause includes death and disability resulting from invasive neoplasms of the skin (specifically melanoma), including ICD-10 codes such as C43.
There were 290 000 incident cases (95% UI 214 000–342 000), 62 800 deaths (46 300–71 000), and 1·71 million (1·30–2·00) DALYs due to malignant skin melanoma globally in 2019.

dysthymia-depressiveDisorders.Definition:
Dysthymia is a mood disorder incorporating disability from chronic depression. The symptoms are less severe than major depressive disorder but are of longer duration. DSM-IV-TR (300.4) and corresponding ICD-10 (F34.1) diagnostic criteria were used.
Dysthymia resulted in 9·66 million (95% UI 6·31–14·4) global DALYs in 2019, equivalent to 0·4% (0·3–0·5) of DALYs. Dysthymia contributed to 7·7% (6·0–9·7) of DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

bipolar-disorder-mentalDisorders.Definition:
Bipolar disorder is a mood disorder incorporating disability from manic, hypomanic, or major depressive episodes. Burden for bipolar disorder overall was estimated rather than by subtype. DSM and ICD criteria were used.
Bipolar disorder resulted in 8·50 million (95% UI 5·20–13·0) global DALYs in 2019, equivalent to 0·3% (0·2–0·5) of DALYs. Bipolar disorder contributed to 6·8% (4·9–9·1) of DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

anxiety-disorders-mentalDisorders.Definition:
Anxiety disorders incorporate disability caused by experiences of intense fear and distress in combination with other physiological symptoms.
Anxiety disorders resulted in 28·7 million (95% UI 19·9–39·3) global DALYs in 2019, equivalent to 1·1% (0·8–1·5) of DALYs. Anxiety disorders contributed to 22·9% (18·6–27·5) of DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

eating-disorders-mentalDisorders.Definition:
This aggregate cause incorporates deaths and disability from anorexia nervosa (AN) and bulimia nervosa (BN). These are characterised by abnormal eating behaviours and concerns over food, eating, and body image (DSM-IV-TR 307.1, 307.51; ICD-10 F50.0, F50.2).
Eating disorders resulted in 2·91 million (95% UI 1·83–4·35) global DALYs in 2019, equivalent to 0·1% (0·1–0·2) of DALYs. It contributed to 2·3% (1·7–3·0) of DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

fungal-skin-diseases-skinAndSubcutaneous.Definition:
This aggregate cause incorporates disability resulting from tinea capitis, a fungal infection of the scalp and associated hair, and the residual group of other fungal skin diseases that are specifically not tinea capitis or onychomycosis.
Globally, fungal skin diseases were responsible for 3·22 million (95% UI 1·32–6·78) DALYs and 1·65 billion (1·49–1·81) incident cases in 2019.

viral-skin-diseases-skinAndSubcutaneousD.Definition:
Viral skin diseases incorporates disability resulting from viral warts (raised growths on the surface of the skin caused by an infection with the human papillomavirus) and molluscum contagiosum (a viral infection of the skin causing waxy, dome-shaped nodules).
Globally, viral skin diseases was responsible for 4·73 million (95% UI 3·03–7·06) DALYs and 98·9 million (95·1–103) incident cases in 2019.

acne-vulgaris-skinAndSubcutaneousDisease.Definition:
Acne vulgaris (or acne) is a chronic inflammatory disease of the pilosebaceous unit associated with an increase in sebum secretion (ICD-10: L70, excluding L70.4).
Globally, acne vulgaris was responsible for 4·96 million (95% UI 2·98–7·85) DALYs in 2019. Of these, 3·52 million (2·11–5·64) DALYs occurred in those ages 15–49 years old.

alopecia-areata-skinAndSubcutaneousDisea.Definition:
Alopecia areata is an autoimmune disease that results in hair loss on the scalp and other parts of the body (ICD-10: L63).
Globally, alopecia was responsible for 601 000 DALYs (95% UI 378 000–891 000) in 2019. Of that, 410 000 DALYs (258 000–609 000) occurred in those 15 to 49 years old.

pruritus-skinAndSubcutaneousDiseases.Definition:
Pruritus (or itching) can be a symptom of a condition or disease. This cause incorporates disability from cases meeting ICD-10 diagnostic criteria for pruritus (ICD-10: L29).
Globally, pruritus was responsible for 786 000 DALYs (95% UI 376 000–1 410 000) and 57·0 million (50·7–63·6) incident cases in 2019.

urticaria-skinAndSubcutaneousDiseases.Definition:
Urticaria (hives) refers to a skin reaction that causes itchy, raised bumps. This cause incorporates disability from cases meeting ICD-10 diagnostic criteria for urticaria (ICD-10: L50).
Globally, urticaria was responsible for 3·90 million (95% UI 2·55–5·58) DALYs in 2019 and 115 million (101–129) incident cases in 2019.

decubitus-ulcer-skinAndSubcutaneousDisea.Definition:
Decubitus ulcer, also known as pressure ulcer or sore, is an injury to the skin and underlying tissue resulting from an obstruction of blood flow due to pressure on the skin.
Globally, decubitus ulcer was responsible for 24 400 deaths (95% UI 17 300–31 300) and 3·17 million (2·88–3·50) incident cases in 2019.

other-skin-and-subcutaneous-diseases-ski.Definition:
The other skin and subcutaneous diseases category encompasses a large group of skin conditions not captured in the other skin categories.
Globally, other skin diseases were responsible for 3·60 million (95% UI 1·77– 6·50) DALYs and 667 million (652–683) incident cases in 2019.

sense-organ-diseases-nonCommunicableDise.Definition:
This aggregate cause incorporates disability resulting from blindness and vision loss due to eye diseases, age-related and other hearing loss, and other sense organ diseases.
Sense organ diseases was responsible for 66·1 million (95% UI 45·1–93·0) YLDs, or 7·7% (6·4–9·3) of total YLDs in 2019.

glaucoma-blindnessAndVisionLoss.Definition:
Glaucoma is a disease that damages the optic nerve, causing defects in the visual field.
Low vision and blindness due to glaucoma resulted in 748 000 global YLDs (95% UI 516 000–1 040 000) in 2019. Glaucoma is the fifth ranked cause of global YLDs due to vision loss and blindness modelled in GBD 2019.

visceral-leishmaniasis-leishmaniasis.Definition:
Leishmaniasis is a disease caused by the Leishmania parasite, transmitted through the bite of phlebotomine sandflies. Visceral leishmaniasis is the most serious manifestation of the disease. These estimates do not represent cases of mucosal leishmaniasis.
Visceral leishmaniasis was responsible for 5710 deaths (95% UI 1690–18 700) and 404 000 DALYs (128 000–1 320 000) in 2019.

chronic-obstructive-pulmonary-disease-ch.Definition:
COPD is a disease characterised by persistent respiratory symptoms and airflow limitation due to airway and/or alveolar abnormalities, usually caused by significant long-term exposure to noxious particles or gases. COPD includes emphysema and chronic bronchitis.
Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) resulted in 74·4 million (95% UI 68·2–80·2) global DALYs and 71·9% (67·9–75·4) of total chronic respiratory disease DALYs in 2019.

pneumoconiosis-chronicRespiratoryDisease.Definition:
Pneumoconiosis is a lung disease caused by inhalation of various occupational dusts. This model combines silicosis, asbestosis, coal worker’s pneumoconiosis, and other pneumoconioses.
Pneumoconiosis was responsible for 479 000 YLLs (95% UI 418 000–551 000) and 440 000 YLDs (293 000–625 000) in 2019. Pneumoconiosis accounts for 0·9% (0·8–1·0) of overall chronic respiratory disease DALYs.

silicosis-pneumoconiosis.Definition:
Silicosis is a lung disease caused by long-term inhalation of dust that contains silica. It occurs in workers in industries such as mining and construction.
Silicosis was responsible for 280 000 YLLs (95% UI 228 000–350 000) and 376 000 YLDs (247 000–539 000) in 2019. Silicosis was responsible for 71·2% (65·3–76·3) of total pneumoconiosis DALYs.

asbestosis-pneumoconiosis.Definition:
Asbestosis is a lung disease caused by long-term inhalation of asbestos particles. Asbestosis is characterised by lung scarring leading to shortness of breath.
Asbestosis was responsible for 59 700 YLLs (95% UI 43 700–69 300) and 11 500 YLDs (7710–16 700) in 2019. Asbestosis accounted for 7·8% (5·9–9·3) of total overall pneumoconiosis DALYs in 2019.

coal-workers-pneumoconiosis-pneumoconios.Definition:
Coal workers pneumoconiosis is a lung disease caused by long-term inhalation of coal dust. It is also referred to as black lung disease.
Coal workers pneumoconiosis was responsible for 58 400 YLLs (95% UI 39 000–79 100) and 16 900 YLDs (10 700–24 800) in 2019. Coal workers pneumoconiosis was responsible for 8·2% (5·9–10·7) of overall pneumoconiosis DALYs in 2019.

other-pneumoconiosis-pneumoconiosis.Definition:
Other pneumoconiosis is a residual category that includes pneumoconioses that are not silicosis, asbestosis, or coal worker’s pneumoconiosis.
Other pneumoconiosis was responsible for 81 500 YLLs (95% UI 63 800–110 000) and 35 400 YLDs (23 300–51 100) in 2019. Other pneumoconiosis is responsible for 12·8% (10·3–15·8) of overall pneumoconiosis DALYs.

asthma-chronicRespiratoryDiseases.Definition:
Asthma is a chronic lung disease characterised by reversible airway obstruction due to spasms and secretions in the bronchi usually resulting from an allergic reaction or hypersensitivity and causing difficulty in breathing.
Asthma was responsible for 21·6 million (95% UI 17·1–27·0) DALYs in 2019, which was 20·8% (17·5–24·7) of total DALYs from chronic respiratory disease. Death rates from asthma were highest in countries of low and middle SDI, while prevalence was highest in high SDI countries.

interstitial-lung-disease-and-pulmonary-.Indicator: Interstitial lung disease and pulmonary sarcoidosis
interstitial-lung-disease-and-pulmonary-.Definition:
Pulmonary fibrosis and pulmonary sarcoidosis are the main diseases in this cause characterised by scarring in the lungs that makes it difficult to breathe.
Interstitial lung disease and pulmonary sarcoidosis (ILD) was responsible for 3·77 million (95% UI 2·86–4·47) DALYs in 2019. ILD was responsible for 3·6% (2·8–4·3) of all respiratory disease DALYs.

other-chronic-respiratory-diseases-chron.Definition:
Other chronic respiratory diseases is a residual category of chronic respiratory diseases that are GBD causes.
Other chronic respiratory diseases was responsible for 2·86 million (95% UI 2·46–3·22) global DALYs in 2019.

benign-prostatic-hyperplasia-urinaryDise.Definition:
This Level 4 cause incorporates disability resulting from benign proliferation of prostatic tissue that can lead to bladder outlet obstruction, urinary retention, and symptoms such as incomplete emptying, weak stream, straining, and urgency.
There were 94·0 million (95% UI 73·2–118) prevalent cases of benign prostatic hyperplasia in 2019, resulting in 1·86 million (1·13–2·78) global DALYs.

male-infertility-urinaryDiseasesAndMaleI.Definition:
Male infertility is defined as the inability to conceive a child after five years of unprotected sex (without using contraceptives) that is not due to another cause of infertility (ie, idiopathic).
In 2019, 1·5% (95% UI 0·8–2·3) of all men—a total of 56·5 million (31·9–90·2) persons—were infertile. Male infertility caused 322 000 YLDs (121 000–771 000) in 2019.

other-urinary-diseases-urinaryDiseasesAn.Definition:
This residual cause encompasses a range of diseases that do not map to other causes in the GBD cause list, including impaired renal tubular function, ischaemia and infarction of kidney, urethral fistula, diverticulum of bladder, and unspecified renal sclerosis.
Other urinary diseases resulted in 46 700 deaths (95% UI 34 300–54 800) and 1·35 million (1·05–1·58) global DALYs in 2019. These diseases are estimated to have also caused 140 000 YLDs (93 900–193 000).

gynecological-diseases-otherNonCommunica.Definition:
This aggregate cause incorporates death and disability resulting from uterine fibroids, polycystic ovarian syndrome, endometriosis, genital prolapse, premenstrual syndrome, menstrual disorders, and other gynaecological diseases (disorders of the breast, ovary, cervix, vagina, and vulva).
Gynaecological diseases caused a total of 8640 deaths (95% UI 4840–12 600) globally in 2019 and 39·6% (36·7–42·6) of all females—a total of 1·53 billion (1·41–1·64) persons—were living with gynaecological diseases in 2019.

uterine-fibroids-gynecologicalDiseases.Definition:
Uterine fibroids are defined using American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists (ACOG) criteria, which state that they are diagnosed by pelvic exam and ultrasonography pelvic, hysteroscopy, hysterosalpingography (X-ray test), sonohysterography, or laparoscopy.
Uterine fibroids caused a total of 4190 deaths (95% UI 2320–6480) globally in 2019. 5·9% (4·5–7·5) of all women—a total of 226 million (175–287) persons—were living with uterine fibroids in 2019.

polycystic-ovarian-syndrome-gynecologica.Definition:
PCOS is defined according to NIH criteria (as recommended by American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists [ACOG]) which includes chronic anovulation and hyperandrogenism (established by hormone measurements or clinical findings) in women in whom secondary causes have been excluded.
Polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS) affected 1·7% (1·2–2·2) of all women, or 66·0 million (46·0–86·3) persons, globally in 2019.

female-infertility-gynecologicalDiseases.Definition:
Female infertility is defined as the inability to conceive a child after five years of unprotected sex (without using contraceptives) that is not due to another cause of infertility (ie, idiopathic).
In 2019, 3·2% (95% UI 1·5–5·4) of all women—a total of 122 million (58·4–209) persons—were infertile. Female infertility caused 659 000 YLDs (222 000–1 570 000) in 2019.

congenital-birth-defects-otherNonCommuni.Definition:
Congenital birth defects includes livebirths (ie, excludes stillbirths and pregnancy terminations) with any condition resulting from abnor-malities of embryonic development, excluding minor anomalies as defined by EUROCAT and defects arising from infections or substance abuse.
Congenital birth defects caused 549 000 deaths (95% UI 448 000–690 000) and was the fourth-ranked Level 3 cause of under-5 DALYs in 2019. The combined global incidence was 62·9 cases (54·0–73·3) per 1000 livebirths and 50·9 million (44·3–58·7) lived with birth defects in 2019.

neural-tube-defects-congenitalBirthDefec.Definition:
Livebirths in which the neural tube fails to close completely during fetal development, including spina bifida (part of the lower spinal cord or meninges are uncovered), encephalocele (sac-like protrusions of the brain and meninges through skull openings), and anencephaly (absence of a major portion of the brain, skull, and scalp).
Neural tube defects caused 85 100 all-ages deaths (95% UI 62 600–122 000) in 2019.

diabetes-mellitus-diabetesAndKidneyDisea.Definition:
Diabetes mellitus is a chronic condition where either the pancreas does not produce enough insulin or the body is unable to metabolise insulin properly. Deaths and disability directly ascribed to diabetes are captured in the estimates for this cause. Other outcomes are captured under chronic kidney disease and risk estimates of elevated fasting plasma glucose.
Diabetes mellitus resulted in 70·9 million (95% UI 59·7–84·2) global DALYs in 2019, 2·8% (2·5–3·1) of total global DALYs.

acute-glomerulonephritis-diabetesAndKidn.Definition:
This Level 3 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from acute episodes of inflammation and injury to the filtering units of the kidney (glomeruli), generally resulting in haematuria, oedema, and hypertension.
722 000 cases (95% UI 595 000–878 000) of acute glomerulonephritis occurred in 2019, resulting in 10 500 deaths (7200–12 200) and 307 000 global DALYs (204 000–363 000).

chronic-kidney-disease-diabetesAndKidney.Definition:
This cause incorporates death and disability due to CKD defined as an estimated glomerular filtration rate less than 60 ml/min/1.73m2 or albumin to creatinine ratio >30mg/g. This includes those with end-stage kidney disease who are on dialysis or have had a transplant.
Chronic kidney disease (CKD) was responsible for 41·5 million (95% UI 38·3–45·0) DALYs in 2019. Age-standardised DALY rates were highest in central and Andean Latin America, at 1348·1 (1203·6–1521·6) and 836·3 (704·2–981·6) per 100 000, respectively (global rate was 514·9 [474·9–558·9]).

chronic-kidney-disease-due-to-hypertensi.Indicator: Chronic kidney disease due to hypertension
chronic-kidney-disease-due-to-hypertensi.Definition:
This causes incorporates death and disability due to chronic kidney disease that is caused by having hypertension.
Chronic kidney disease (CKD) due to hypertension was responsible for 9·96 million (95% UI 8·58–11·5) DALYs and 24·0% (21·0–27·3) of total CKD DALYs.

chronic-kidney-disease-due-to-glomerulon.Indicator: Chronic kidney disease due to glomerulonephritis
chronic-kidney-disease-due-to-glomerulon.Definition:
This causes incorporates death and disability due to chronic kidney disease that is due to glomerulonephritis.
Chronic kidney disease (CKD) due to glomerulonephritis was responsible for 6·90 million (95% UI 5·78–8·13) DALYs and 16·6% (14·3–19·2) of total overall CKD DALYs in 2019.

chronic-kidney-disease-due-to-other-and-.Indicator: Chronic kidney disease due to other and unspecified causes
chronic-kidney-disease-due-to-other-and-.Definition:
This cause incorporates death and disability due to chronic kidney disease that is due to unknown or unspecified aetiologies.
Chronic kidney disease due to other and unspecified causes was responsible for 11·6 million (95% UI 9·70–13·7) DALYs in 2019.

urinary-diseases-and-male-infertility-ot.Definition:
This Level 3 cause includes all urinary diseases specified in the GBD cause list (e.g., urinary tract infection, urolithiasis), male infertility, and other urinary diseases that do not map to GBD causes, such as urethral fistula and diverticulum of bladder.
All urinary diseases and male infertility together resulted in 9·34 million (95% UI 7·99–10·9) global DALYs in 2019 and were responsible for 0·4% (0·3–0·4) of total global DALYs.

urinary-tract-infections-and-interstitia.Indicator: Urinary tract infections and interstitial nephritis

urolithiasis-urinaryDiseasesAndMaleInfer.Definition:
This Level 4 cause incorporates death and disability resulting from episodes of urolithiasis, which is defined as stone formation along the genitourinary tract.
116 million (95% UI 93·0–140) cases of acute urolithiasis occurred in 2019, resulting in 13 300 deaths (10 600–16 300) and 604 000 global DALYs (477 000–745 000).

mental-disorders-nonCommunicableDiseases.Definition:
This aggregate cause incorporates disability from schizophrenia; anxiety, bipolar, depressive, autism spectrum, attention deficit hyperactivity, conduct, and other mental disorders; idiopathic developmental intellectual disability; and deaths and disability from eating disorders.
Mental disorders resulted in 125 million (95% UI 93·0–163) global DALYs in 2019, equivalent to 4·9% (3·9–6·1) of DALYs. DALYs were composed almost entirely of YLDs. This resulted in 125 million (93·0–163) global YLDs in 2019, equivalent to 14·6% (12·2–16·8) of YLDs.

schizophrenia-mentalDisorders.Definition:
Schizophrenia is a chronic psychotic disorder that involves positive symptoms (eg, delusions, hallucinations) and negative symptoms (eg, flat affect, loss of interest). DSM-IV-TR (295.10–295.30, 295.60, 295.90) and ICD-10 (F20) criteria were used.
Schizophrenia resulted in 15·1 million (95% UI 11·0–19·2) global DALYs in 2019, equivalent to 0·6% (0·4–0·7) of DALYs. Schizophrenia contributed to 12·2% (9·6–15·2) of total DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

alcohol-use-disorders-substanceUseDisord.Definition:
Alcohol use disorders includes deaths assigned to alcohol use disorders or accidental poisoning by alcohol codes and cases of alcohol dependence, a substance-related disorder involving a dysfunctional pattern of alcohol use, and fetal alcohol syndrome.
Alcohol use disorders was responsible for an estimated 17·0 million (95% UI 13·5–21·5) DALYs globally in 2019. The highest prevalence rates were seen among individuals 30 to 39 years old. Prevalence of alcohol use disorders was 2·39 times (2·21–2·57) greater in males than females.

drug-use-disorders-substanceUseDisorders.Definition:
This aggregate cause incorporates death and disability resulting from opioid use disorder, amphetamine use disorder, cocaine use disorder, cannabis use disorder, and a residual category of other drug use disorders.
Drug use disorders caused 18·1 million (95% UI 14·3–22·0) DALYs, or 0·7% (0·6–0·9) of total DALYs in 2019. From 2010 to 2019, the all-age DALY rate due to drug use disorders increased by 11·5% (9·0–14·7). In 2019, 51·3% (49·6–53·3) of global drug use deaths were in the USA.

opioid-use-disorders-drugUseDisorders.Definition:
This cause includes deaths from opioid overdose in adults and deaths in neonates attributed to the mother’s opioid use. For disability, we make estimates for opioid dependence as defined by either DSM or ICD diagnostic criteria.
Opioid use disorders resulted in 12·9 million (95% UI 10·0–16·2) global DALYs in 2019 and 0·5% (0·4–0·6) of total global DALYs. In 2019, males accounted for 72·2% (70·6–73·9) of total global opioid overdose deaths.

cocaine-use-disorders-drugUseDisorders.Definition:
Cocaine dependence is a substance-related disorder involving a dysfunctional pattern of cocaine use. Included in the GBD disease modelling were cases meeting DSM or ICD diagnostic criteria.
Cocaine use disorders resulted in 1·15 million (95% UI 0·933–1·43) global DALYs in 2019 and were responsible for 0·05% (0·04–0·06) of total global DALYs.

amphetamine-use-disorders-drugUseDisorde.Definition:
Amphetamine dependence is a substance-related disorder involving a dysfunctional pattern of amphetamine use. Included in the GBD disease modelling were cases meeting DSM or ICD diagnostic criteria.
Amphetamine use disorders resulted in 1·40 million (95% UI 0·954–2·04) global DALYs in 2019 and were responsible for 0·1% (0·0–0·1) of total global DALYs.

cannabis-use-disorders-drugUseDisorders.Definition:
Cannabis dependence is a substance-related disorder involving a dysfunctional pattern of cannabis use meeting DSM or ICD diagnostic criteria.
Cannabis use disorders resulted in 690 000 (95% UI 421 000–1 080 000) global YLDs in 2019 and were responsible for 0·08% (0·05–0·1) of total global YLDs. 65·7% (64·8–66·6) of global DALYs from cannabis use disorders were among males.

other-drug-use-disorders-drugUseDisorder.Definition:
Other drug use disorders is a residual category for substance-related disorders including deaths and disability due to dependence on hallucinogens, inhalants, solvents, and sedatives.
Other drug use disorders resulted in 1·95 million (95% UI 1·54–2·49) global DALYs in 2019 and was responsible for 0·08% (0·06–0·09) of total global DALYs.

depressive-disorders-mentalDisorders.Definition:
This aggregate cause incorporates disability from major depressive disorder (MDD) and dysthymia. MDD involves the experience of depressed mood or loss of interest or pleasure almost all day, every day, for two weeks. Dysthymia symptoms are less severe but chronic.
Depressive disorders resulted in 46·86 million (95% UI 32·93–63·80) global DALYs in 2019, equivalent to 1·8% (1·4–2·4) of DALYs. Depressive disorders contributed to 37·3% (32·3–43·0) of DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

major-depressive-disorder-depressiveDiso.Definition:
MDD is an episodic mood disorder, incorporating disability from the experience of depressed mood or loss of interest/pleasure almost all day, every day, for at least two weeks. DSM-IV-TR (296.21–24, 296.31–34) and ICD-10 (F32.0–9, F33.0–9) criteria were used.
Major depressive disorder (MDD) resulted in 37·2 million (95% UI 25·7–51·2) global DALYs in 2019, equivalent to 1·5% (1·1–1·9) of DALYs. MDD contributed to 29·6% (24·9–34·9) of DALYs for the aggregate of mental disorders.

psoriasis-skinAndSubcutaneousDiseases.Definition:
Psoriasis is an autoimmune disease characterised by areas of raised, red skin with silvery scales, which may be itchy. It is an immune-mediated disease that involves inflammation and excess growth and abnormal behaviour of certain skin cells.
Globally, psoriasis was responsible for 3·51 million (95% UI 2·50–4·64) DALYs and 4·62 million (4·46–4·78) incident cases in 2019.

cellulitis-bacterialSkinDiseases.Definition:
Cellulitis is a skin disease marked by a bacterial infection that affects and spreads through the skin and soft tissues.
Globally, cellulitis was responsible for 551 000 DALYs (95% UI 378 000–660 000) and 42·9 million (40·4–45·4) incident cases in 2019.

pyoderma-bacterialSkinDiseases.Definition:
Pyoderma is an aggregate cause that incorporates death and disability resulting from abscess and other bacterial skin diseases and impetigo.
Globally, pyoderma was responsible for 1·65 million (95% UI 1·25–2·01) DALYs and 1·09 billion (1·06–1·13) incident cases in 2019.

tuberculosis-respiratoryInfectionsAndTub.Definition:
